rEQfE8YUyz8GNr7P6xH6jA.text: Its an all night Greek diner. Breakfast around the clock. Huge menu. Reasonably priced. Really people only go there for the breakfast menu and Desert menu. The breakfast is good but typical greasy spoon kind of food. Decor is solidly tacky. This place is all about DESERT and the desert case is always full of pastries and cheesecake on display. The young ladies that work there are appealing in a refreshing natural way.

kvz8uKNyPQEbou3YrwfDMg.text: The Landmark is a good diner.  After all, Guy Fiere has eaten here (Food Network: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives).  The food is standard for what you would expect.  I had a western omelet, rye toast, bacon, coffee, OJ, and bacon.  The coffee was amazing - which is key for a good diner.  The rest of the food looked good but was lacking in flavor which was disappointing.  I am going to chalk it up to an off day or maybe what I ordered.  The house favorite seems to be the French toast.  I missed out this round but next time it's on!  Seriously, people rave about how good the French toast is.  Also, I've got to try their deserts.  They look out of this world and are made on site at a bakery they have in the basement of the Diner.  In fact, I may just go for desert and coffee sometime.  As for the rest of the experience, the service was excellent,  the environment is perfect for a diner: clean, cozy, it just has that certain Je ne sais quoi.  Despite being on Central Ave, the crowd is diverse in a way you will not feel out place.  Also, people bring their kids (at least for breakfast anyway) so you can consider this a good family place.  Now, at night that is probably another story as the night can bring out a different element.    As I had said, this is a good diner.  I will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuxedo mousse cake
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana cream pie

3snU_BSvh3mGHPbz7ypibw.text: I have been here so many times and it has never failed to impress. I have tried many different things here. I have gotten the fried fish & calabash shrimp special with 2 sides of fries many times. It never fails to impress. My sister has gotten that a few times as well and she enjoys it too. Almost every single time she gets the chicken souvlaki. Both of my parents have also had it here and they love it as well. One time I was deciding what to get and I decided to try one of the daily specials. I got the salt & pepper catfish and I am very glad that I did! I ordered it with a fries and a cup of chicken soup as my sides. Everything in this meal was so great! The soup was good and the fries were cooked perfectly! It came with 6 pieces of fish which is so good for being a little less than $10. I was very impressed with this meal so I will most likely have it again. Also I have had the Salmon special and it is good! The food here will always fill you up and leave you with leftovers! Plus you can even take their amazing dessert to go. My personal favorite dessert is the chocolate mouse cake but all are very food. Honestly they have something for everyone here even my younger sister who is a very picky eater. It is a great place for a variety & just to have a good time!

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh Atlantic Salmon
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. chocolate mousse cake and carrot cake

A6ghn73P0iGPjzsr_flahQ.text: My wife and I had dinner... the service was amazing... our waitress was the best!!! Food was good.

T3_oi3gNbRv_usk1hRGWJQ.text: I finally visited the famous Landmark Diner this past Sunday morning.  It's in a semi-sketchy part of town, but the restaurant itself looked very clean, updated, and not-at-all sketchy.    The breakfast menu was pretty big (although no benedicts), and the prices matched my small hometown's diners.  Now *that's* impressive for Charlotte.    I ordered the Northern omelet -- corned beef and swiss cheese.  It was good; your basic omelet with huge chunks of corned beef.  Someone else got the Challah French toast.  It was literally the BIGGEST order of French toast I've ever seen in my life.  The bread slices were about 2" thick.  The country ham side had been "rinsed" (at the recommendation of our server) but it was still very salty.  Good, but salty.  Another member of our party got the pork chops and eggs entree.  For only $8, there were eggs, potatoes, toast, and TWO pork chops.  It was a great deal for a very hungry boy.    If you have room after their huge portions, there's always dessert.  And I'm not talking just any dessert.  These are massive-sized desserts.  Three- and four-layer cakes.  Turnovers the size of your head.    Big meals, fantastic prices, pleasant atmosphere, and a clean restaurant.  What more could you ask for in a restaurant/diner?

OHnXaq0V5teP3KY67NesgA.text: Bring your appetite when you come here! Portions are huge. Everything is fresh.  We ordered everything from an omelet to the Louisiana et toufe and we loved all of it! Desserts are amazing and it is no mistake to have them I display right by the door! No way your walking out that door without one of those treats!   Definitely coming back here!

t6WyrkVi2Wk3ul4pdy4MqQ.text: I used to eat at this place all the time years ago, but it has really fallen off. Our server wasn't really friendly at all. I ordered a western omelet and it was not good at all. It was just a little cheese sprinkled on top of the omelet with salsa and the cheese wasn't even melted. There was nothing inside the omelet and it had a few sprinkles of green onions on top. That was the worst omelet I've ever had. I can make better omelet at home, which is what I should have done. I was very disappointed. They need to take a lesson or two from IHOP!!

1tNP36cmPVhtnzEyfrv2kQ.text: First time at the Landmark. , first the prices are so reasonable for the value of the meal. My husband got the tom turkey with dressing and it was a enough for two maybe three people and very good.. My Dad got the liver and onions and loved them. The menu has sooo much to choose from. The  desserts were beautiful and also  so much to choose from. We took home some baklava and it was divine. The only downer was the pastrami sandwich it was not good at all however the onion rings were perfection. Definitely will return, especially for desserts. The service was spot on. And it definitely is not a dive but a very clean nice diner and parking was easy!

JMtmsoF715qv9h0Bb5rXmg.text: Huge menu, enormous portions, good food, open late, friendly staff. It is truly a landmark in Charlotte. I can only name a few diners left around Charlotte: Kopper Kettle, Open Kitchen, Landmark... Must go if you haven't been.

_f2pa1vyRttv5Lx_UWlAnQ.text: I saw this restaurant on my favorite Food Network show, Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives (Hosted by Guy Fieri). You know, "Tripple D".  I was in Charlotte for the weekend so I thought why not try out a restaurant from that show.   I came there on a Sunday morning. The line was out the door like any busy, famous, and neighborhood-friendly restaurant for brunch. (TIP: Always go where the locals go.) We waited for 15 minutes and were seated quickly.  The waitress and staff were sweet...like how they should be in the south. We ordered jalapeno bombers for appetizers. It was good...like Church's Chicken good! I had the greek sampler... moussaka (greek lasagna), Spanakopita (spinach pie) and graped leaves stuffed with rice and feta cheese. Oh, I had a side of green beans and corn but too full to touch it. My favorite was the moussaka because I'm not a big fan of feta cheese that was in the spanakopita and grape leaves. It was good and I finished it. I ate what was suggested on Tripple D so I left there happy and full.  Oh, don't forget to check out the desserts in the glass window by the door.

p3o-m6ELlY3ugHPk1ostlg.text: A diner with a huge menu. Although it isn't the highest cuisine it is a great place for a good meal at a good price. Spanikopita is pretty good as is the Greek plate. If you like flounder fried they have it with or without the skin and you get a big portion. When I want to eat a lot or share with someone this is a great place to sit and eat at your leisure. Never had the cakes or pastries but they look good. Outstanding Eggplant Parmesan too.

00dP2kKs-pTJIR3EJgGB2w.text: Went to this place again today. I'm a sucker for places featured on Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives. It's good, not great.   Today I had the turkey dinner Guy ate when he visited. It was fine. The turkey was tasty but the dressing was overly saged. The gravy also had an odd consistency and no real flavor. For sides, I had Mac and Cheez (tasty) and collards (very poorly seasoned).   The desert case is always an impressive sight, but I didn't partake today. I'd return to try the breakfast. I've heard good things. Worth a try for sure, but don't expect greatness just because Triple D was there.

3ldDeiZVXEcJ2HlrAGnlHQ.text: Love this place! Just to moved to Charlotte and this has quickly become one of my go-to spots!! The food and desserts are DEE-LICIOUS and you get a ton of food for a great price. If you haven't had the Turkey Tom, you're missing out!!

FMzjuRH4Ya_8QD03XXObng.text: Hours of their business are WRONG. Better call them first before you drive across town looking for food. Not sure how their food is, but Wendy's is open when they said they would be.

2Jny-hmMRr5xBIvwsue8lQ.text: I love this damn place. The Hallah French toast is amazing. The Philly cheese steak will blow your mind and the 5 layer chocolate cake is like a chocolate orgasm in your mouth. Sometimes the wait when sitting down to eat can be long and some servers aren't as sharp as others but the food MAKES everything worth while. Plus I've started ordering for pickup and it's ready in 15 minutes tops. Much faster and eating this amazing food without pants watching Netflix makes it that much sweeter.

Y1IIKRFSD4EA0VM5YLIfZg.text: Like many have said this joint was surprisingly ordinary for a place featured on the Food Network, but a couple of items are pretty mindblowing and the good news is that you can pick them up in a case right by the register. Curious?  I'll save the best for last and start with our appetizer that we had to try after hearing Guy Fieri rave about it - the spannakopita. Lots of spinach and the first I had ever had with dill, but it really worked!  For the entree, my waitress was raving about the chicken slouvaki so I gave it a shot. Pretty solid. My wife had a BLT and fries. Safe choice but solid again. Now is where the real fireworks happened...   On the way out we passed by a glass case I had already eyed on my way in and we couldn't resist the temptation. Ordered a slice of carrot cake and two pieces of baklava. Both items were best-in-freaking class and were devoured as soon as we got home. They make each daily and you can tell. The carrot cake had lots of goodies (coconut, raisins, etc) and the icing was great. As for the baklava, the best I have had, and this coming from someone whose childhood friend was second generation Greek whose mom made fresh baklava weekly. 3 stars overall, but 5 for that glass case!

FC8qyT7Ae5C82FYck74k2A.text: Pretty irritated. Drove almost 20 mins from home to here to eat. I didn't feel like late night fast food so I picked this spot. I get to the door and it's locked. Website says it's open for another hour and 10 minutes. Open sign is still lit up. Girl washing the window says they close at 1am. It's currently 12:45 am and the website states 2am (according to Yelp anyway). I specifically picked this spot because it said it would be open. I wouldn't have driven 20 mins if it had said otherwise. I don't think I'll be returning.

S_-B2qkqGmi1oeFICJ3cqg.text: Every time I come in here with my husband out waitress always has a TERRIBLE attitude. The food isn't great either. Oh well

qDtF1KlNZv9S596sCt-KaQ.text: Landmark is the standby restaurant. It's the place you can go to fulfill your late night munchies or to take your grandmother for breakfast the next morning. It's comfortable and has a gigantic menu with plenty of variety. It is a Charlotte staple and that is why I keep going back.   The food is not outstanding. Most things are  okay at best. Other things are just gross, like their southwestern omelet. Never order that. Their coffee is hot, brown-tinted water, but they are quick to refill it for you. (If I can see through my coffee, I'm not happy.)   Their service is a mix. Some servers are not very attentive and others are too pushy and tend to over-share. The dessert case is impressive. Though, some items look better than they taste. The chocolate cake, for example, is huge, but it has no flavor! How can you have a four layer chocolate cake that doesn't taste like chocolate? Most of the other sweets are pretty good.   It's also one if the most fascinating places to people watch. Go for that, if nothing else.

XgjBN1qAS8OE5kw7CYxfTQ.text: Everytime I go to the Charlotte area to stop by Landmark. They have wonderful food and excellent staff members.

LfmRQqQXmHAeD_OcW7PPRQ.text: My favorite breakfast place ever.  I love the Greek omelette and the home fries, which are crispy and delicious, and the omelette has a lot of quality feta.  I adore the challah French toast.  This is the only place I will get French toast now because no other place is as good and worth the splurge.  It is fluffy yet filling and to die for.  Great service.  The dessert case is full of beautiful desserts made in house.  Favorites are the key lime pie and the coconut cake.  If I lived nearby I would be here every week.

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Challah French toast with bacon

t0VOy3hBdQXSf-LBNwX4KA.text: Meh. That's about all I have to say about this place. Sticky menus, sticky tables, sub-par food. We saw this on DDD and decided to try it, but weren't impressed. Chicken salad sandwich wasn't anything special, boyfriends steak was just blah. There's just too much on the menu... nothing really stood out as "oh my god i HAVE to have this". Server was nice though. Crappy parking. Skip this place if possible, honestly wasn't worth my $35.

2bGDcDjZW-22ONAKh4tGMA.text: The amount of food for the cost AND it's goooood! Biscuits and gravy, two eggs, home fries for  $3.50. I'm not kidding. So tasty. It's a diner, so it's not fancy, but everything was great, including the hostess with sass!

3Jg-AY0XfNfxHYwbJpoKhA.text: Stopped for a quick breakfast.  It is a comfortable atmosphere with quick friendly service.  Unfortunately, the food did not measure up.  I ordered biscuits with gravy, eggs over medium with a side of country ham and a cup of coffee.  It was a lot of food for 10 bucs.  The biscuit was ok (not as good as the one I had at McDonalds yesterday) as was the gravy - not real flavorful.  The eggs were fresh, but were cooked over easy to where I could not get them on a fork.  That was the best part of the meal.  The country ham was large and served with a steak knife.  Now I know why.  It was grilled so long that it was the consistency of jerky.  It was hard to cut and harder to chew.  It also had a very strong swine taste, which got worse the more I ate.  I really liked the atmosphere, the friendly waitress and the quick service, but the food was not good enough for a return visit.  But it was a lot of food for 10 bucks!

XBi8wNoXTD6Bn3oNYehx7w.text: I don't know whether to give 1 star or 5, so I'll stick to the middle.  Its weird.  The coffee is good, they are open late, and the menu is ginormous.  That said, its kind of dirty old run down diner with not that great of service.  I'll keep this one short and sweet.  Go for coffee and desert or go for the Greek food.  Many other options on the late night for breakfast type food.  And as others have said, parking can be an issue.

AIpYWmWjqjzh2j0XmwY_sg.text: This place is "ok".  They have a large variety of foods from all different categories to choose from. It is really hit or miss. Sometimes the food is pretty good, otherwise a disappointment.  Baklava is delicious! Good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable soup

67MIzdQBn8QRTz7aoH7PlA.text: What can I say about Landmark?  "Special" seems insufficient.    Outside of the airport, this is THE BEST place to people watch!  Located on Central Avenue, you'll quickly discover that this isn't the best part of town.  However, they cater to everyone.  The owners are Greek and the menu offers a multitude of Greek inspired entrees.  The food is good and the desserts are amazing.  Baked fresh daily, they offer a wide variety of desserts in gigantic portions.  Because they have so many options that are all homemade, they don't offer every dessert every day of the week.  They offer daily specials that will give you the biggest bang for your buck.  The baby back ribs are some of the best I've ever had and the lobster bisque will knock your socks off!  The Greek specialties are well worth a trip as well.  This is a great place to meet with friends and kickback over a cup of coffee.  I often visit with friends simply to enjoy a sweet treat and a cup of Joe over conversation while people watching.  We've certainly seen some interesting characters milling about.  This is also a frequent hangout for CMPD officers on their coffee break.  The service is varied and most of the servers have broken English.  The ones that do speak clear English are usually slurring their words for other reasons.  Look closely and you may see a little white powder around their nostrils.  No joke.  Like I said, people watching at its finest folks!  I've seen potential serial killers, drug dealers, little people, one eyed Willie, Uncle Duck, Big Mama and many more...

wms2PYo7B0W2AqhG-tuQrw.text: The food is always good! I feel like you can't go wrong here. I always get the chicken souvlaki. It's one of my favorite things to eat! The portion is so large I have two meals out of it.

iNuwMPnsODWr_lyxw6K9Zw.text: The worst.....why does yelp expect me to say more..they're awful. The end. Midnight diner is better, cleanee and the staff is nicer

tViwaUd2MZJvrasfm3VQVA.text: I've been going here since I moved to Charlotte in 1997. Great food and always wonderful service. Try the French toast with their homemade bread!. It's why I'm finally writing this review.

gMXoZYvkpXvswPC4XR201Q.text: It's been over a decade since I last ate at Landmark! We went for Sunday lunch. The specials for the day caught my eye and I had to order my favorite dish of all time; French onion soup. Not only was this soup light and flavorful but the cheese was melty goodness. My husband ended up helping me finish (and he's not a soup kind of person). The main course was fantastic, loads of food! I managed to devour my plate but my husband and daughter barely got by.  Overall our experience was great, it gets really loud and some parents aren't able to keep their kids from running around. Other than that it's really good food and fast service!

Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

3tU1-SsSfLWIBuLNjnIpYg.text: Excellent and Jessica is very professional, patient and very attentive to detailed orders

ihASTjhPP_Rz4S9KjWSAKw.text: Only real diner in Charlotte. This place is the jam trust me- just go now. what are you waiting for?!

oogA7J0Wv95hfVkDkmeEQg.text: So good best breakfast I had in North Carolina ever. The pastries selection is amazing I love this place and would recommend it !

FzjKN363ZCdVVtP6jrWR9A.text: At the table and I haven't even left yet. I've been coming here for years and decided to take a new friend to my favorite spot. She ordered the Manicotti and had one bite and didn't like it. We asked the waitress if we could trade it out for something else. The gentleman who I guess is a manager here said he "can't replace the food simply because you don't like it, cause other customers like it so there is nothing I can do if you dont" I always come here, the staff is wonderful and I never have any problems. And whenever we didn't like something they always replaced it. No problem, excellent service. I am so embarrassed that I talked her into going here tonight and will not be taking anymore friends here in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Only had a bite. Dish is still full and they wouldn&#39;t replace it

KSuiCdOAUvGnnTA2KLG2XA.text: Was in Charlotte for a long weekend and had this place on my target list for a while. The place is a out parcel of a strip shopping center. It has two sides with a counter and another side with booths and tables. The menu is large  with a ton of options. The group I was with tried a few breakfast items and a few dinner items.  For breakfast items the challah French toast and pancakes are both light, fluffy and flavorful. Would order both again. The dinner entrees were a club sandwich and baked ziti. The club sandwich  was huge and tasty. Baked ziti was ok and garlic bread was surprisingly solid. We also had a side of Mac and cheese which was excellent. A old school style.  Finally we tried a piece of lemon cake and tall chocolate cake. Both were moist,  light and very tasty.  Overall a very solid visit and I look forward to return visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious half eaten tall chocolate pie
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sign out front
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Challah French toast

u4dA-7xSYRkXSCB5N3iQiw.text: This place has been around for a very long time and on late nights I do stop here from time to time. The staff on the other hand, I can't help but to say they are shit and all pieces of shit when it comes to night service. I will still give them 3 stars bc I love the turkey plate there and grilled cheese with soup, simple but home style comfort food to me. The deserts are delicious. But I hate their staff. Idk if they are hired or family but all need attitude adjustments and retraining.  On numerous times during the night shift they pick and choose customers. Some they will allow in and others that aren't of considerable "race" to them they turn away.  They should know if they hours are on the door people expect service

ZWcPwJKmHhW9G2-XeGk5xw.text: Customer Service tip for the  hostess/cashier at Landmark:   smile at your guests, present a warm and welcoming demeanor. If you need help with this, I can show you how it's done.

nLIN_lcfWuoICqZH0hlTWQ.text: This is a must see(or eat I guess) in Charlotte. I have been hitting up the Landmark Diner for more than 20 years and it's still just a diner, nothing special really until you start looking for a little dessert after your meal, that's where this place really shines. The dessert case is stuffed with freshly baked Greek pastries and all manner of cakes and pies! I recommend the tall chocolate cake or maybe the carrot cake if you're on a diet. The key lime pie ain't too bad either. I digress, the food is diner fare.  When I say diner fare I mean that you could stop at any of the thousands of Denny's or Waffle House locations around the country and have a very similar meal. You will not have a cake or pie or pastry anywhere else that will top this place. The desserts are where it's at here!

wADDMPQiy3BXgvWr2NQVXQ.text: Definitely a late night Charlotte staple! Love landmark diner, great food, large variety, service is usually pretty good. Come here quite a bit, and will be back! Only advice is drop the bagged lettuce for the salads, I got the Greek once, was good, but bagged?! Really!! Gross!

l0WFZJlb0XdfO8Ui2HAg-g.text: I love the Landmark! Delicious food made the right way. Unlike the stereotypical diner, this location appears to have lots of different people, it does not cater to a certain type, it caters to everyone. The Italian foods are good and nobody I know has left incredibly unhappy ever. The service is good and the deserts taste great. The prices are average for what you get, and the decor is typical semi-outdated diner colored blah. In conclusion, a good, average restaurant if you want a quick and easy eating experience.

JO-dEWHsg1Mfefz19BM6hw.text: I am here about once a week.   Where do you get the coffee?  It's amazing!  The food has always been hot and the staff has been friendly and prompt.  You are like an oasis in that little section of Central! THANK YOU!

dKpXRfBiLS7OaSKIFIGqgQ.text: This place is everything a diner should be!  The food is good.  The service is prompt and friendly.  The prices are quite reasonable.  The portions will not leave you hungry.  I am looking forward to my next visit!

Y50JlBCzlTrwqQGAxaD6Kw.text: The Landmark is a good place to get anything you want 24 hours a day- this menu is seriously about 12 pages long, so if you can't find what you want then you are too picky.  I used to hit this place late night a lot in highschool, and while the food is good, more than once I tried to go and they were closed because a crime had occured inside.  Great for people watching if you like to like the possibility of a little danger in your evening.

DqW4YyPBGgZfkrCVyiuoTw.text: I have eaten at Landmark on various occasions, and have never had a problem until now. 3 of us decide to come in for a quick bite to eat, and this was the closest place. We were seated and after a while or so a waiter comes to take our drink order ( granted they were busy so I will let his tardiness to greet us slide) We get our drinks and there are more people coming in and they are seated. We order our food and patiently wait as we see everyone else receive their orders including the people that came in after us. More time passes by,an hour to be exact ...by this point we are late to where we had to be. I see our waiter attending other tables and we still are sipping our watered out drinks, I give him one more opportunity to pass by without our food, and then I call him over and let him know that it has been an hour and a half waiting on our food, I am tired of waiting and no longer want my food. He explains to me that one of the dishes we order takes time to make, but I am not buying that it takes an hour and a half to make one plate. I wait 5 more minutes and out of utter frustration decide to leave, my party leaves while i go over to the cashier to pay at least for our watered down drinks and saltine crackers that one of us ate, right as I am leaving the food comes out and I was instructed to pay for the food, that I just said i no longer want. The cashier tells me that the food has to be paid for now because it is already cooked. I told them I refuse to pay for food that i am not going to eat. And she insisted that I can at least take it to go and wait even more time for it to be put into a box..needless to say I paid for food that I waited an hour and 45 minutes for that I did not eat. I will never be back, nor recommend anyone else to go there.

owPiK9jEnpnAfQc_bFsUMg.text: Best breakfast ever!!!! I ate dinner there a few times. Not terrible, but nothing to write home about.  My husband and I try to go every weekend for breakfast, and we have loved it every time!

lpA96pOyRVVGrrPcWH4haA.text: Mmmm... classic Greek diner - try the Challah French toast!!!  Very very tasty.  The chicken souvlaki platter was pretty good (I'm a big fan in general of chicken souvlaki).  The coffee is decent, too, and they are always there to refill it.   When you walk in the front door, you will be greeted by the dessert case.  They look so so amazing - mile high chocolate cake, frosted brownies, cheesecake galore!!  I have always been too stuffed to order any dessert... but one of these days I will!  They look too good not to be, so I am going to trust my gut and recommend them on appearances alone!

6Go103k1LG_nhPFyMiB9Kg.text: Went for the first time yesterday. Noticed that the place was full of people so I knew I was in for a treat.  The wait was a bit long but we also had someone with a wheelchair in our party so they had to accommodate that.  The waitress (Natasha) was wonderful - she recommended many favorites, one of them being the ribs - which I ordered and they were awesome!  The  food took a little long to get to us (no doubt because of how busy they were) and at one point my 2 year old son started crying because he saw the table next to us get their food and thought the French fries were for him -  well the waiter noticed my son crying and quickly went to the back to get him a plate of fries to tide him over.  So thoughtful!  And that gesture makes me want to give them more business!  The dessert selection is off the charts and so is the tall chocolate cake!  I'm a believer now and will be going back to try it all!

0lz5f-8p0u_9V73d_rLfHA.text: I had the raspberry cheesecake for dessert yesterday.  Wow!!!  Good stuff.  My mom had the baklava-very nutty if you like baklava. It was like eating desserts on steroids!

CRKVmgcHQ437qiq1YED1ig.text: A diner should be able to consitently make your eggs the right way,  this place just cant seem to get it right,  ITS CALLED over medium people its not that hard.  I rather frequent Liberty east or the Big view

cDZ_He7_me17uRwGyQx8bQ.text: this place is terrible i use to love it growing up and its gone way down hill the waitress we had was rude my grandmother asked what the sides were and she decided to announce to our table where they were and said it so loud the whole restaurant could hear here my grandmother looked mortified.  the silverware we received were dirty and the waitress looked like we inconveinced here to ask for some other ones.  Then we waited an hour for our food (for a table of 5)  and half of ours came out cold.  when we finally asked for the manager he came to our table dropped off our food didnt introduce himself or anything.  we actually had no idea he was the manager till the waitress told us.  it was my cousins birthday so my aunt asked if they did anything special they dont and she said not unless you want to order a cannoli or something.  she then brought it out after my aunt told here no and tried to use the fact shes hard of hearing as an excuse.  She then proceeded to follow us to the register afraid shed get a bad tip for the poor service.  it was terrible i will NEVER go here again.

TQckYKKKsXCM9krcRu4rQg.text: Yet another gem I have discovered as I eat my way through my new neighborhood!  My bf and I went here on a Friday night at about 1 am, after a little bit of drinking because we were starving.  The first thing I noticed, the beautiful dessert case that lures you in as soon as you step in the door.  So many cakes, pies, brownies, cheesecake....agggghhhhh.  So tempting!  The next standout is by far the gigantic, atlas-sized menu that has about anything you could possibly want on it.  We eliminated certain pages that we knew we didn't want and narrowed it down from there.  It's definitely a daunting task!  I went with 3 cheese mannicotti and my bf had roast turkey with gravy, stuffing, and cranberry sauce.  The portions were HUGE!!!  And very reasonably priced.  The food came out really fast and while it was not the best mannicotti I've ever had, it was damn tasty and the tomato sauce was right on.  The best part about my meal, however, was by far the pineapple coconut cake I had for dessert.  Oh My God....I cannot tell you how yummy this slice of sugary heaven was.  Light and airy, with layers of pineapple filling.....mmmmmmmm.  Bf had strawberry cheesecake and it was not good.  It was too thick and the strawberries had no flavor.....my suggestion, eat the cake!

D00Z3_KRWcey0vn04WIs4A.text: Landmark is definitely a favorite place of mine the service is good the food is plentiful and the prices are low, it's not a super fancy place but a good old fashioned diner..

7i7P8f_Lb5BzSyoFDx1kEw.text: We wanted to grab a quick bite to eat, so headed to The Landmark Diner on Central Ave. We could tell from the parking lot that they were packed, but decided to give it a try.   When the hostess told us it would be 15 minutes, she saw a look pass between us that said we didn't want to stay. We were about to leave, when a host said he had a small table in the bar, if we didn't mind.   We didn't mind at all, as we were hungry and would have say anywhere. I ordered the Onion soup and my husband had the Ruben sandwich. The Onion Soup is THE BEST I have had in Charlotte! It comes in a nice big crock and is dripping with melted cheese; no skimping here. YUMMY. I also ordered some sides of vegetables, and they could have used some seasoning. They were OK, but that's it.   The manager came out with some fried squash and offered it to us. We were seated right next to the kitchen, so I guess they had an extra one and he felt bad for the poor location. It was nicely fried squash and was salted perfectly.   My husband enjoyed his sandwich, but he gobbled up the squash.   As usual, we were too full for dessert. Although they look great, we never have enough room for them.

CcaBQCwsqeDbP4K3KJYtKg.text: Love Landmark.  Reminds me of the diners back home in CT / NY / NJ.  Large variety of food. Best dessert menu that I've seen in Charlotte. Wish I lived closer.  On second thought, maybe it's best that I don't live so close :-).  Food can be inconsistent as can the service.

UIDjt8tTCObkHP5P6-MD-w.text: Yes the menu is about 12 pages long and is probably as long in height as a newspaper when unfolded.  So our chances of getting at least one good thing on that menu appeared to be in our favor.  WRONG.   The first time I was with a friend. We shared stuffed mushrooms and thought, please don't let this be a prelude to our meal. Not so good.Nor was the tasteless huge slices of bread they bring.Was it stale?  I went for the Gyro.Figured Diner = Greek food, so, Gyro = Winner. Yeah, I figured wrong. The gyro at Showmars is wayyy better. The real kicker was the broiled seafood platter. Yes, I warned her, Don't order that .Until you know what the quality of a diner is ,everyone knows, stick to the basics. Well after that awful dish,we learned quickly "the quality" of this diner. Let's just say I'm not the type of person to say "I told ya so"  Should I even comment about the service?Maybe not.  It might be a good idea to offer drinks in two sizes.I know myself, I have  a big thirst but the size of the glass to serve a beverage in was puny.I took like one sip, it was gone.Even my female friend was looking at her empty glass in three sips and trying to get refills was a joke.  The best part of the meal was actually not even our meal itself. It was the visual of the dessert case when we walked in that started to make us instantly salivate which tasted delicious in our mind.  Who knows maybe we just ordered the wrong things,but if we decide to give it another go, It will be for breakfast. Diner = Breakfast, So, AHHHHH this theory is shot.

dMIsvqD7tUc_I6RCMq3tKw.text: My husband and I had a negative take out experience  the week prior to our visit Sunday morning. My husband and I loved Landmark. Over the past ten years we have always found our way back. This morning we decided to go for breakfast. We had terrible service. We were seated in a booth and our waiter, while friendly, was just out of sorts. He got our drink order wrong twice and brought out luke warm coffee. We had a small accident at the table and needed napkins. It took him well over 5 min to bring more napkins. Finally, when he attempted to correct the drink order he brought me a dirty glass. That prompted me to inspect my silverware, it too was grimy. I am not sure if the owners have changed but the Landmark I have loved for over a decade is not the same. The service is horrible and the food is not good anymore. The week prior we ordered take out salads and they were not well prepared. Steer clear!

yuxGVl9soi7ITzunlL7xUw.text: The first thing you see when you walk into Landmark is a giant pastry case stuffed with delicious looking desserts.  This is pleasant to look at for a while, but this is where my pleasant dining experience ended.    Our service was lackluster, at best, borderline surly at worst.  Drinks were not refilled except upon request and despite our friendliness, it seemed almost impossible to get our waitress to crack a smile.  The restaurant wasn't busy at all so I'm not sure what her problem was, but it was definitely off-putting.  I ordered 2 eggs over easy with toast, bacon, and fries. I'm allergic to onions, and home fries sometimes have onions, and I wanted potatoes, so I decided to play it safe.  After all, how bad can a plate of fries be?  As it turns out, pretty bad.  Like our service, they seemed lackluster, bored.  Maybe I shouldn't expect a diner to have amazing fries, but I've had amazing fries at diners before, and with such an extensive menu and supposed high status among Charlotte local restaurants, it wouldn't kill them to make a batch of crispy fries that didn't just lay insipidly and moody on the plate, refusing to be brightened with a generous ketchup bath.  The bacon was fried up too crispy for my liking, but that's a matter of personal taste.  Everyone agreed that the fries were...not great.  The eggs were fine the toast was actually really good (especially dipped in egg yolk...mmmmmm)   The rest of my party were also less than satisfied with their food.  They also nickel-and-dime you really hard for substitutions like a bagel and cream cheese, which is a huge pet peeve of mine.  Is toasting up a bagel and bringing out a packet of cream cheese really so cost-prohibitive that you've gotta soak me for 12 bits?    All in all it was a LACKLUSTER diner AND dining experience.  You want normal diner food, go to the neighboring San Remo or Liberty East.  If you want EXCEPTIONAL diner food, go to Mattie's Diner.  If you want a step up from Waffle House, by all means check out Landmark.    Just don't order the fries.

0ybc42VhNDG8UzgI9movVQ.text: Greek Family ran love it. The Turkey and stuffing is full of flavor. The menu is large very large but you will find some thing for you. And the spinach bite dinner just eat it.

o2O8HTW0O1_YZQsYc5zbeg.text: The Landmark Diner has been around for years and years for a reason...really good food at decent prices. They were even featured on diners- drive ins- and dives, yep it serves up a tasty dish.....usually. But just like any other establishment they can have an off day, but you had better not say anything while you are there. They have a reputation for not  handling critiziism very well. The last time our family ate there, my wife said that the chocolate cake was that great ( usually is ) ......mind you she just said  this to the waitress who asked if all was ok. The owner came to our table and really showed is butt off. Sadly this was not the first such experience but I can assure you it will be the last. We put up with their rudeness and poor service because the food was better than average for too long. If Guy fieri had not complimented that tool of an owner he would have been tepreated the same too.

1NJSYBxUJ6s-o5blzU_D5Q.text: My wife and I had breakfast and I was impressed with the coffee. I also had bacon and eggs which were acceptable, but not great.My wife loved that they did her toast on the grill for her. I would go again. The service was prompt and friendly.

kt71EEiyDMdafofZxMvq8Q.text: This place was phenomenal! The price you pay for this place and the amount of food you receive is unbelievable! I ordered the Italian Tour and received about 4 pounds of food! It was delicious. It was a combination of Alfredo Pasta, Chicken Parmesan and Baked Spaghetti! Wow is all I can say!  The service was so-so but the food definitely makes up for that! The Spanikopita was authentic and tasted delicious! Overall a pleasing experience!   I recommend!

NBBzLv1qrHp23rBbwdTv3Q.text: They have their own bakery in the basement and so you can only imagine all the different cakes and stuff one can delight themselves in. Very good food as well.  ;-)

hYaNMgSse8Eox1ldG6Jweg.text: I've been to Landmark a few times while visiting the area and would not shy away from return visits. The menu is very large, they serve breakfast any time and I haven't run into anything I haven't liked yet. The Gyro is really good. The ranch dressing here is pretty amazing; I highly recommend it even if only for dipping French fries in. The servers are friendly but average. The portions are large and the prices are good. If you're into the star struck thing, Dakota and Elle Fanning go here (or at least have gone). They have autographed pictures right when you walk in. It's also been showcased on the TV show "Diner's, drive-ins and dives".

7wqHmelxUd9GHAIXbJ3zOA.text: I have to give Landmark 5 stars because, while I've only ever been here for breakfast, it's consistently delicious & quick and I've still never had better french toast in my life (their Jumbo Challah French Toast).  My friend who grew up in Charlotte talked me into going late late one night to try the french toast after I first moved here, and it didn't disappoint.  I am always disappointed when I take people here and they decide to get something else.  Everyone should be enlightened to it's yumminess.  On another hand, my parents have been to visit me on numerous occasions over the past few years and always insist on going to Landmark for breakfast as they have been disappointed every time I've tried taking them somewhere else.

75RO97e_wfDketoU-JWnqA.text: Just had an excellent breakfast at Landmark. I've been to several other CLT area diners, and this one is my new favorite. Cool location, lots of locals, and great food. I had the western omelet with grits and a biscuit. For $4.95, it was a huge portion and delicious. Landmark also has a huge dessert case, filled with amazing looking sweet treats. If you are looking for a very cool local diner, try Landmark.

g6A5aYHDyPmWPlTnLQI-Zg.text: We went there about 3 weeks ago on our way to Virginia. I have to say the food was good. I got the Chicken Souvlaki and my wife the Pizza Burger. Both were very good for a diner. I have been to other diners where the food seems mass produced and is sub-par. The desserts looked very good, but we didn't try any. The service was very good as well. It was pretty late, but you didn't get the sense from the servers that they just wanted to get out of there. I do have to say that the restaurant is kind of out there, so it was a bit of a hike off of I-77. Overall, 3.5 stars would probably be more accurate, but that is not an option! I would definitely go back on a late night if I am passing through.

bK9hVTHsgdqHOglH-lSA_w.text: I gets strange here after about one o' clock and there is nothing wrong with that.  All sorts of folks come here for late night grub.  I thought the prices were too much, I would rather go to San Remo's next door; the service is better and much quicker.    A lot of times you have to wait for a seat at Landmark, even at this late hour.  The people watching is pretty good, I saw a group of what appeared to be S&M performers, one was fitted with a belt made of AK-47 bullets, creative!    They do have a humongous menu, but they don't have egg and cheese biscuits, that is a no-no.  I guess it is kind of grungy here, but I feel like it is a lot more upscale than most late-night diners.

SIvzwvgBMSLHoeh06LjsVA.text: I originally gave Landmark two stars, but for the good ambiance and service, I bumped it to 3. This is the first of hopefully many 24-hour (or at least, extended-hour) restaurant reviews I want to write, and I'm actually saddened not to be able to give this place a better review because I had such high expectations. But, alas, I must.    I wanted to have a little celebration tonight, and since drinking is a no-no for me these days, the next best thing, of course, is pie.  Having heard great things about Landmark's deserts, I made a date to meet up at 9pm and check them out for myself. The decor of Landmark is nice and cozy, and it is heartening to see all the hustle and bustle inside this restaurant on such a desolate area of Central Ave. When you walk in, you are immediately struck by the incredible dessert case. We sat down and ordered decaf and our waiter told us that he would brew us up a fresh pot.  Very nice.  We then got to the ordering--once piece of banana cream pie and one hot cherry pie a la mode. The pie slices came out quickly and looked incredible, but unfortunately, looks can be deceiving.  The banana cream pie was loaded with a cool-whip type topping, not the real whipped cream that I think truly makes a banana cream pie.  The pie filling itself seemed to have a lot of that cool-whip filling in it as well and very few bananas, which just didn't work. While the cherry pie was sufficiently warm and the ice cream acceptably cold, I wasn't impressed by the pie crust--it just seemed a little dense and cake-like. The deserts WERE huge, but I think they ultimately had a  size over substance problem.  I didn't order any "real" food, so I can't speak to that, but, in all, I'd have to say the pie slices we ordered were a disappointment.

45bmGHaGzTuCDhR5pPauOA.text: This is a family restaurant and has pretty much everything on the menu and some Greek goodies as well. I had their special pork tips with rice. It was definitely YUM!! The portion was huge. The seating area is clean and our server was quite pleasant.

PxJQQKVEXsEhAJ_s9qvIag.text: Truly a gem in Charlotte that it has a 24h diner that is better than half of the New Jersey diners i have been to! Food overall is good to very good. The biggest treat of this place is the cheesecake, made the way you remember it up north. You may come here to feel that you're back "up north" for the diner experience but if anything, the best cheesecake in the state of North Carolina is at Landmark. Period.

0zDuEXRhLiQG3UHHQI6ElQ.text: Okay, so it's not a five star restaurant but for the fare and prices The Landmark is my first choice for breakfast and late-night dining. Prices are very reasonable, food is very fresh and plentiful, and the wait staff is friendly and attentive. What more can you ask for? Maybe a bigger parking lot?

lWZYumnEn3O4vqFQpCcqRg.text: Food was ok. I asked for broccoli with cheese and they put government cheese on my broccoli..... extremely unsatisfied and will not return. I do not recommend this restaurant unless you want to pay a high price for low value food.

sBYIn0T9X_L2U7tQlayVEQ.text: Great food! Had a fantastic waitress by the name of Theresa.  Such a sweet spirit and phenomenal CUSTOMER SERVICE SKILLS!!

sT1N45TEkyo3dk-kLZMQpQ.text: This place has never disappointed me. Their food is classic diner fare. From the fried flounder to the moussaka everything I've eaten here is good. The Tom turkey plate is one of my favorites. They also have one of the largest desert cases I've ever seen. All of which are made in house.

qAJDik4MWuhHkq-UakeVLQ.text: I have been going here for over 20 years and have always loved it...  Still do...  but the last few times there I have witnessed one of the young check out gals start fights with patrons about tips...  The Landmark is close to losing a long time valued customer....  Its not a good look Landmark.....

20uhCYp1p2aoEn5DVjmulA.text: Our favorite spot.  Always..  Breakfast today was steak and eggs..  perfect.  Our server, Helios was efficient, polite..  a pleasure to have look after us.  See you soon

tdC9_XV8OzxSrZiO7tmTPg.text: Unbelievable. I've never been so shocked by the lack of professionalism at a restaurant before in my LIFE.  As a restaurant server, I work To Go orders daily, so I'm used to people changing their minds, or editing their orders.  I called the diner to place an order for Buffalo wings, unaware that my husband had already ordered food from another establishment. Not even 3 MINUTES after placing my order, I called back to cancel and the woman told me "THE ORDER HAD ALREADY BEEN PLACED AND THEY PROBABLY ALREADY STARTED MAKING THE WINGS." She then told me to be "more sure next time" before calling to place an order for pick up.  EXCUSE ME?!? Management needs to train this employee on PHONE ETIQUETTE and professional mannerisms before allowing her to take another order.  I would have been fired if I EVER spoke to a guest in such a manner.  Rude.  Never Again.

LsNQvh8QrHWpAZl5zlsj1w.text: Love this little diner tucked away outside of Plaza Midwood. We had a great first experience. LOTS of food for a great price. Service was quick and friendly. Food was also great!!! You'll def be seeing us again. So glad we found this place

J7i-o6kG92L4jSxDbbrBkQ.text: Featured on Diners, Drive-ins and a Dumbass, but we came here because it was open late and we wouldn't need a reservation. Go figure that on a Saturday night, the place was packed and we were told by the hostess and by our waiter that they were short staffed. Which did make for a 30 minute wait for a table and then a wait to place our order. But by that point, it got back to normal.  My wife had the Greek salad and pronounced it excellent. Loaded with feta cheese, anchovies and lots more stuff than lettuce, she said it was fresh and crisp and very tasty. The included pita bread slices were excellent.  Having checked the reviews, I opted for the chicken souvlaki. Lots and lots of chicken, a great salad and a big pile of tasty fries. Yum!  Pastry counter looked awesome. Cheese danishes. Cinnamon horns. Cherry turnovers. Wow!  Very inexpensive meal and once the crowd was clear, the service was great.

Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Souvlaki at Lendmark

vQn5FpCZelpBftglNOtkrQ.text: I've been frequenting the landmark for over 20 years. I just had the worst service ever. My Husband ordered a well done steak and it come out rare. My daughter ordered flounder and they gave her old trout. The owner Larry would not come out to 20+ years customers to address the issue. We are not the type of people who try to look for discounts on our meals but we felt the owner should have done something to compensate us. My Daughter is now throwing up. This 20+ year relationship is over. For the amount of money we spend whenever we come here we can certainly find better places to eat.

aiT1QXkTQdG--UYg6uKohg.text: My friend and I went to Landmark for dessert on Friday evening.  Several of the desserts on the menu, i.e. lemon pie, banana split, among other items have been discontinued. Please update your dessert menu options.

gPZq7uX-agPlLWFD9o7wSg.text: Wasn't busy at all, sat for 10 minutes without anyone even looking at us to ask what we'd like to drink. Felt like I wasn't suppose to eat there, as if I didn't belong and wasn't going to be waited on.

zx5_so2N-7wZ3Dm76HTrqg.text: My experience today was service was a little slow (probably due to some groups all arriving around the same time); however, my server was kind and kept filling my cup with hot Joe.  I ordered a basic breakfast which was cooked perfectly.  I especially liked the char from the flattop on my Virginia Ham; moreover, the hash browns--well, they're the real deal.  They peel then boil the potatoes, then cut them into irregular shapes and finish them on the grill.  Each of the potatoes had a proper sear on them which gently crunched in my mouth on each bite.  So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diner basics all neatly arranged

-22VPJP8Ju_-RZgmzZGHfw.text: The decorations and seating layout are nice. Wait staffers are friendly. Food is tasty and reasonably priced.   I got the Greek omelet made with 3 large eggs, feta cheese, tomatoes and onions. I just wish there had been spinach in it too. I opted for home fries- they were so good! I also got rye toast with my meal. I loaded up on ketchup- always been a "Ketchup Kid!" My friends are regulars here- one got a deluxe burger and the other got fish; they enjoyed their meals too!  We parked in the rear lot behind the business where it looks a little sketchy, but there are a bunch of spaces. However, if you'd rather face the diner from the plaza and other businesses, it looks more welcoming and has more of a "normal plaza look and feel." I had a wonderful time with my friends and i'm sure I'll or we'll be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greek omelet with home fries and rye bread.

1vjLy_QPqdxFsmMz9ITJUA.text: So. You walk in to an ok greeting, sit at an ok table, order from an ok server and receive ok food. I asked for croutons with salad, they were out. I asked for crackers and was told I could have 2 but after that, they were .40. To add boiled egg to salad is $1.10. Don't get me started on refills. All in all, it was.... You guessed it.... OK....

xh8CuGgv8kRaZ1zwdwprqg.text: I've eaten here for years and the food is the same but the service has gone way down hill, they clearly can't retain front of the house staff and most of their staff is talentless and lazy. Management really needs to get involved and turn this place around. The deserts are always the best!

GKfDR9Rr1sI0dCw1MZgj2Q.text: Went with some friends for brunch.    Food was delicious and we were seated right away!  Our server was definitely not on his A game - super spacey/all over the place...not quite sure what was going on there but regardless I'd definitely go back for the food.   The woman at the register was super friendly too!

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hash Browns (potatoes weren&#39;t super well cut - I had a huge chunk in mind and my friend literally just had an entire potato in the middle.
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Challah French Toast with Bacon

n4ACFN2LJHx5ckHgrKPmpw.text: I'm from Brooklyn and diners are a staple there.  So, imagine my happiness when i walked in surrounded by familiar pastries,  menu and layout.  We were hungry from CIAA weekend and chose Landmark Diner.  It was 2 am but we were seated right away.  I got the challah bread French toast and it was perfect,  just like back home.  I'll be back.  Two thumbs up

eIoggyaDX5bkR2bE4UNWSA.text: Love the casual atmosphere.   They've got a huge menu that has Greek, American, Italian and more!  Their desserts are heavenly!!!  I like the food.   Love the full bar and the desserts!!  Great place to go late night!

NChqEzmtInLxSH-4IRUjIg.text: I don't know what the hype is about this place but finally got to try it and it was lousy...... Had a spinach and feta omelette and I've never tasted a very bad one but this was awful....... There was Zero feta in it and the  spinach was all chopped up and it tasted like it had something else in it.... it was just an odd flavor that tasted bad..... I had a few bites and tossed it aside...... The home fries were okay a little dry but okay...... I also tried the pancakes and they were quite uneventful....... Overall I wouldn't rush back here I've been to much better places..  And usually I like coffee, really good coffee and this coffee was mediocre at best.

dxUIdhIR5lMIvJ4FHcM9FQ.text: Two words - Absolutely Fabulous! My husband and I were in Charlotte for the weekend and a friend suggested this restaurant. We could not have been more pleased! The service was great. The food was out in a timely manner. The menu was so vast, it was hard to decide what to order. And more importantly,  it tasted great! We were so impressed, we couldn't leave without telling the manager how much we enjoyed our dining experience. We will definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

4CHzT3Hr0t0F9nMSoUY76g.text: I have been coming here since I was in my moms belly lol. The staff is always super friendly and fast. The food is always GREAT. I have probably had everything on the menu, but typically I get the large garden salad, with a side scoop of chicken salad, and a bowl of french onion soup. NEVER DISAPPOINTED!

LbD1gWX4AapQCbb8YXKG6A.text: Not what we were hoping for from the reviews.  This was our first and probably only visit so we may have come on a bad day.  The good- service was excellent and attentive.  The desserts are massive, with apple turnovers the size of your head and cake slices that are easily enough to feed 3-4 persons.  The bad - the entrees were just not good.  The open faced beef sandwich had thin dry roast beef (almost jerky) covered in a gravy so thick and floury that you couldn't eat it without lots of water.  The vegetable soup was tomato based but tasted like Campbell's or Progresso that had been heavily peppered.  Except for the salads, the rest of the meal was pretty rough.  I see a lot of good reviews so it may just be the timing but I don't know that we are going to try this place again.

llKqncseqqHjT24RjfN9Mg.text: Growing up in New York, the word "diner" holds a special place in my heart. When I moved south 7 years ago, there have been many places that call themselves diners, but this is the first to remind me of being at a diner in NY.   From the row of older gentlemen, sitting at the countertop, reading papers, to the quality and variety of the menu, this is a NY/NJ diner. I ordered the Pastrami and Swiss omelette and was blown away by the amount of food, as well as the quality.   If I was to offer any criticism, and it's subtle, but I like my hash browns to be a bit crispier than the ones I ordered. Otherwise, this will be my new breakfast home anytime I'm in Charlotte!

LwSMLbGL7IWosO3rrui_Qw.text: Tosh is was a DDD so we had high expectations and they came right through.  Our waitress was super cool, food was great turkey Tom and the wife had roasted pork with stuffing, only cow that was good.  We got stuffed so we could not have any of those divine desserts in the case, all made on premises.  We'll probably go back today to par-take.  Worth the trip and scarf it down!!!

Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey Tom. So tender, so good
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Another DDD winner

8VpiIq7kH_SiyROe5GvplA.text: I've been eating there for years. The food is good.  The Greek salad is wonderful and the ranch dressing is unforgettable l am sure they use Greek yogurt. Most of the things I've tried have been good only a few things I didn't care for.

2H-Po9gm7YjCxeR5AasAqg.text: I absolutely love eating breakfast here. The Belgian waffle is so scrumptious and the grits are the best I have had thus far.

d5sTdd2LSKK73mIo9SilmA.text: My first visit here and it was great! Firstly this place opens late check the schedule but closing ranges from 11 pm- 2 am depending on the day you go. It was fairly crowded at around 9 pm on a Friday. When you 1st enter there is a huge case of delicious looking baked goods my, my,my! We were quickly seated and given menus and drink orders taken. I tried the Greek pita with chicken and the platter comes with Greek salad and fries! The pita was fresh and packed with food, it is delicious and too big to finish in 1 sitting. The salad was so yummy with the Greek dressing . Yum! I'll be back again maybe I'll try breakfast next

DvhtXg2Q4V0jCbVyaSuEYQ.text: Charlotte, NC Military-ish friend took me here  because he was from the here and told me it was great here. I was not expecting the food to be that great- but yes it was delish!!!!! I recommend.

cU-hKWGKvicEehXLBWZh9w.text: Love this diner! Have had breakfast and lunch with no complaints. I hope to try some of their sweet treats on display one day.

OzvQIgAj49GIkMFM49wK5Q.text: For a diner, it was some good food. But that's what you get, diner food.  I ordered an omelette and hash browns.  The omelette was HUGE and filled with ingredients. The hash browns were the big chunks of potato, also a solid choice. The meal could feed 2 people but I chose to take on the challenge. The waiter was nice and friendly, but our food did take longer than I expected.

zCFdpfPdn1S6P1Gz6Tqb3g.text: Good breakfast, but nothing spectacular.  The best item is their coffee and hot cakes.  Veggie omelet was just ok, breakfast potatoes are good, and my English muffin came out a little hard and burnt.  If I lived right next door then maybe I would come here again, but to be honest there are so many better breakfast spots in Charlotte.

oqwDGv53bzTkSR-28EvR6Q.text: I'm never disappointed each time I come here.  The service is always excellent, food is great, and dessert ABSOLUTELY AMAZING.  The ribeye steak of the Land & Sea is cooked perfectly and it's so tender.  I really don't have anything negative to say about Landmark.  It tastes great at any time of the day.

iKrzgyvVCE-wOlG4GHHRdA.text: Paula and I travel to Charlotte about 5-6 times a year. We both grew up in the North (d**n Yankees!) and we've bemoaned the lack of *real* diners in the South since we moved here in 1998. All too often, we will drive up to a place that calls itself a diner, only to find that it is nothing more than a glorified soda shop and hamburger joint - not that there is anything wrong with that, mind you, it's just that we have always had high hopes of finding something like what we remembered back home, and come away feeling empty.  So when we saw the Landmark featured on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives, we decided to give it a shot. Getting there was definitely NOT half the fun - it's in one of the least attractive parts of Charlotte, and you can't see the sign until you are nearly past the entrance to the parking lot. If you are coming up Central Avenue from Eastway Drive - which you probably will be if you are coming from I-85 or from the south side of town - you want to turn left just at the end of the median, right after you pass Kilborne Drive. Parking is shared with a small strip shopping center, and there's not a whole lot of it, but every time we have gone the place has been packed.  Once you get there, you will realize as soon as you walk in that this is, indeed, a diner. The menu for both breakfast and dinner is huge, with many classic diner favorites and an array of specials. Prices are about as reasonable as you could ask, with many choices under $10. Portion sizes are large - we wonder sometimes how they make money given what they charge and the amount of food you get.  Recommendations:  1. Any meal with stuffing as a side dish. I've had the pork and stuffing, and Paula's had the turkey dinner. The proteins are cooked perfectly, and the stuffing is just like Mom (or Grandma) used to make. 2. Pot pies. These are HUGE! We're not talking some small Swanson-sized tin here, we're talking a full-size tureen! 3. The French toast made with Challah bread. Go lightly on the butter and syrup, and savor the bread; trust me, you will be glad that you did.  I was mildly disappointed in the omelets, but that's mostly because I am a cheese-a-holic and the omelet was *very* light on filling.  If you're missing diners, this is the place to go. Now if we can just teleport a clone to Raleigh...

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

npMrw0ZOP7psIceCPKCFqw.text: This meal was great!  Went for breakfast and got the French toast, it was huge and covered in cinnamon and powdered sugar... So good.  The syrup was warm which was a surprise.  Eggs and bacon were great.  Our waitress Heather was so sweet.  Would definitely come back!

p2gahKLBageFovIeAqMiqQ.text: Went here for a late breakfast due to prior reviews and was at first not impressed.  As we went through our meal, I started to understand what keeps others going back over and over. The food is good, just as most diners, lots of selection! I would not say the service was excellent, but it was almost as if you were having dinner at your grandmother's house.  They really cared, and that was what set it apart for me.  They even gave my 3 yr old several options for the animal he would like his pancake to be! He chose a turtle, which made his day! We will definitely be going back!!!

gwg2_q2_asV8l6YV360imA.text: The food was soso. I ordered pancakes. I prefer my a little light but the came out dark. I haf tgem sendt back and yhey did bring ourt a new order but it was the same. My silverware wss dirty. Hair in food...mewww. And discourteous server. I'm done. The end

GQTY_pphLMplvzZzBb-lzQ.text: Absolutely the best diner in Charlotte. I'm never disappointed. The service is always excellent, food is great, and breakfast is always spot on made to my instructions. The dessert display is absolutely mouth watering and they taste darn good too.  BE CAREFUL what time of day you go, for example 11am on Sunday it is very busy.

2petrLJWEYPC1Juhj8uGtw.text: I'm selective when it comes to Greek diners. My 8 years in Chicago are to blame. I was stoked to try Landmark and had an awesome meal with friends. Their all day breakfast items looked delicious - especially the decadent challah french toast! I decided to be a purist and go for a traditional chicken souvlaki plate. SO GOOD. Juicy, marinated chicken chunks on a warm pita with a light yet flavorful Greek salad on the side, plus their homemade tzaziki sauce. I could've eaten the tzaziki with a spoon. The portion sizes are generous as are the prices. I'm excited to return for an omelette and check out their extensive menu soon!

_HklqKihBTvG1Y6VWsWVBA.text: Another reviewer had it right - huge menu, decent food, great prices. Bring a group, and no one will have trouble finding something to eat - unless that trouble is deciding! The menu is more expansive than it needs to be, but most choices seem solid from the small percentage we've been able to sample so far.   Last night, our group of three ordered regular meals, and enough food appeared to feed 6 or more. Nothing stood out as The Best version of (Tour of Greece, Texas BBQ Burger, Tom Turkey platter, etc.) that any of us had ever had, but it was all served hot, quick, in large portions, and well under budget. After a long day-into-night at work, and battling traffic on the snowy roads, it was just what the doctor ordered. The dessert case was beyond tempting, but sadly, none of us had any room after the smorgasbord that had been laid in front of us.  Regarding breakfast, three simple words:  Challah.  French.  Toast.  That is all.

_zWRB9duCxDKwAWaDoGuoQ.text: Dropped by Landmark for a late night bite and got a great comedy show from Christina, our waitress!  She gave us great service and kept us in stitches the whole time!  The food was yummy too!

cXWqXqb9fTnv7X1Id7jpDw.text: There is rarely a negative thing to say about a late night diner that is open until 1 AM all nights and 3 AM on the weekends.  With breakfast, lunch and dinner all day and night, you have a huge selection of options.  From roast beef to turkey to shrimp salad to tuna melts to gyros, they got your covered.  Our waitress was so incredibly nice, even at 11 PM at night.    The onion rings were a little too thin and over fried, but other than that, no complaints at all about the food.  Plus, they were featured on diners and divers. We selected this place because it was open late and only 20 minutes from where we were staying and we were not disappointed.

fe6bOvB7NDcr66IZQn80nQ.text: So....my boyfriend was wanting to try "some place new" and he loves chicken pot pie (which I don't cook because I don't like) and heard that they have it as a special on Thursday night. To me, this place was just okay and I won't rush back. Here's the run down:  Food: there were a lot of options and it was a little overwhelming. Our waitress really recommended the turkey with stuffing so I went out on a limb and tried it. I liked it as much as I think I could like turkey with stuffing. There was a lot of gravy (which I scraped off) and I didn't even finish 1/2 of the meal. I also started with a salad with greek vinaigrette. I actually liked the vinaigrette. I just wish there had been some cucumbers or something in the salad - it was just bag mix of iceberg lettuce and some tomatoes. My boyfriend loved his chicken pot pie. It was huge and came out piping hot. He says he would recommend it to others but would want to try some of their others items next time since they had so many options. We took the strawberry shortcake home and tried it later and we were not fans. It was pretty dry.   Price: Honestly, the prices are great. Nothing more to say about that.  Service: I'm split here. Let me explain. Our waitress was Christine and she was so friendly, funny, attentive, and helpful. We really enjoyed her. When we went to pay, my boyfriend was standing at the counter and asked for dessert to go. The woman he was paying asked the other hostess (a young woman with long blond hair) to get the dessert. I'm not sure what happened but she came back to the counter 2 minutes later and threw our dessert on the counter and then stormed away. It was so awkward and extremely unprofessional. The woman checking out next to us just stared and said "why does she have an attitude?" It was sad that this was how we ended our dining experience. Without her temper tantrum, I would've given this place three stars.

jNuBoAsSrW_nifIJvJ607g.text: I live right across the street so I come in frequently!  The portions are usually quite large so we split a entree and add an extra side salad.  They have a little bit of everything on the menu, and most of it is great! The last time we came we got a chicken pot pie and we actually find several small bones (which after two or three we couldn't eat anymore - who wants to anyways?)  Other than the chicken pot pie everything was good! Breakfast is definitely my favorite!!  They have an amazing selection for desserts! Cakes. Pie. Baklava. Everything. Sometimes we just come for the cheesecakes!!  I will mostly stick to dessert and breakfast with the spot.

HUGYA0K50og7G5yrIaxz2w.text: I've been coming to the restaurant for at least 20 years and have always been satisfied with the service and food, but TONIGHT has caused me to never go back. I'm not one to complain, furthermore asking for discounts or free food. First- there were 3 of us. We ordered and waited and waited, meanwhile watching everyone around us ordering and food coming out after us. Second- 20 minutes later AFTER everyone in the dining area had their food, the waitress came over and said she didn't know what happened and went to find out. I ordered the chicken philly ( just meat and cheese ) they cooked it with peppers and onions, so they had to remake it, then it came out with mushrooms. I was fine with that and picked out all the mushrooms. My bread was soggy so I was eating just the chicken. The waitress went to ask the Owner to discount the meal because of it being wrong twice. He said he wouldn't discount it but would remake it, therefore he wanted my sandwich back, so with chicken still in the bun and fries on my plate I gave her my plate and then the waitress came back to me and said he wouldn't remake it because you ate all the chicken out of it. Then I said give me my food back that you took from me and she brought out a whole new sandwich which has mushrooms on it again, knowing I didn't want that from the beginning. The customer service that the owner displayed tonight was unexceptionable and rude. They lost a loyal customer and I won't be back.

zXGu2YALQyPYBMxDiqYwxw.text: Needs to update the time on which yall close. Called at 12:25 says closes at 1 . Person on phone said already closed. Needs to update hours online.

ppvw7XA43z2ZXxgIbGem-A.text: I have given this place a fair chance. I have eaten here three times...tried three different things...and all have been bad. Bad bad bad. First time- Chicken Alfredo. The chicken was okay, had a little seasoning...wasn't the worst chicken I have been served. The alfredo?Zero taste. No salt. No seasoning. It was the most bland pasta sauce I have ever had in my life. I had to load it with salt and pepper for it to even taste like anything. Large portion though. Second time- Chicken fingers, loaded potato. The loaded potato is the only thing from Landmark that I would eat again. The chicken tenders were tough. Third try today- turkey triple decker club sandwich and onion rings. OKAY. This seemed like a safe choice. WRONG. The turkey is a "carved" turkey....and it is disgusting. It smells like bad lunch meat packaging. Its white and large chunks, and the cheese is abysmal off brand cheddar slices. I asked for mayo but no condiments on the sandwich. The bacon/lettuce/tomato is decent. I wish it had been a BLT. The onion rings are okay, and the ranch is very good thankfully. Really..if you have any self respect at all about what kind of food you spend your money on...just take the money you planned to spend here and go elsewhere. Or cook at home. It will be better than this place.

_laZQq_ZdEHuclKfn0307w.text: Great dessert here! Spare your time and don't order the entree's. I've tried several entrees here and were dissatisfied with all of them except their grilled chicken salads (Mediterranean and Greek). If you order an omelette or grits they will put sliced American cheese in it.

It's your typical diner, nothing fancy with a huge menu and basic plates of food. The cheesesteak was good and huge! I almost ate the entire thing and all my fries and couldn't move. I should've know better. Prices were reasonable; I paid $20 with tip for a cheesesteak w/fries, size of chocolate cake and coffee. I wouldn't come back here.

sZbB5jJ8YSJYCCR42vkm3g.text: This used to be a great restaurant when we moved here in 2006 but over the years it has changed. The food is ho-hum or tasteless. Today My husband & I stopped for breakfast, my medium eggs were totally runny barely solid, wheat toast barely toasted, grits tasteless & I needed a spoon, husband's biscuit & gravy had no flavor. Best things on our plates were link sausage. Waitress never came back except when we were getting up to go to cashier. We're done with them. Go next door to Lempira. We should went back there.

yGBqex7cAIPbyi_ebcq91A.text: If you've never eaten at this famous Charlotte diner you need to put it on your must-do list. It has truly been a "lamdmark: on Ventral Avenue for so many years. Breakfasts, lunches and dinners are hot, fresh, plentiful and quick. I can't imagine any American dish NOT available here. The service is excellent though wait time can be frustrating especially when you're HUNGRY. It's well worth the wait though. My husband loves the beef.liver with p ipns(never will understand why) and I always deliberate between their great salads, fish or burgers. No matter which one ends up in front of me I'm never disappointed. An added bonus which is reason enough to visit is their AMAZING selection of desserts: baklava, cheesecake, tortes and five layered iced cakes. Heaven to the taste buds! All of this at very reasonable prices. What's not to enjoy???

G3RZo14Cj4_YtfBRrmPBuA.text: So my friends and I had come in rather late at night, around 11 due to an event that kept us later than expected, and we were hungry since we hadn't eaten since 12 that afternoon. We were seated promptly and the menu was rather diverse with low price points. We also were recommended to this place by locals so we had some decent hopes too. Together we ordered 2 appetizers, two burgers, and 2 gyro platters.   When the appetizers came it turned out alright, nothing special but it had some taste. Then the entrees came out and the portions were surprisingly large, so it looked good. But then we had a taste of everything. The burgers were tasteless and bland, the fries on the sides had no flavor or seasoning, and my potato salad that I received as a substitute for fries tasted like nothing. It was a heavy disappointment. The gyros were decent in terms of taste but they ended up rather dry. We were planning on getting desert but the meal was so disappointing that we decided against it. It just seems like your paying for the quantity not the quality here.

eW16QRqukF0LAOfnYGm--A.text: This place was amazing. The food and the service was so good, I event went back to try something new the next day. Everything is so filling and tasty. The portion sizes of food are relatively big but great for the price you pay. The first day the display case of sweets caught my eye but I was too full to try it and the same with the second time I went. I forced myself to get the Blueberry Pie anyways and it was worth me being miserable from eating too much. I loved every bite of the pie, French toast, omelette, grits, etc. Whenever I come to Charlotte again this will be one of the restaurants on my list!

bpsRtbUnMSAWLpmamkmvag.text: This diner isn't in a fancy neighborhood, but it is worth heading out to Central Ave for their amazing menu. This place is always the same. The menu is enormous and almost everything is amazing. I have been day and night and have never been disappointed. The food is diner food, so it can be a bit of greasy spoon, but you'll like it! The dessert case will greet you and you should definitely get something before you leave. I think they make everything homemade. I almost always start with the French Onion Soup -- they have some of the best. The Challah bread is so good too. Killer sandwiches here. I have tried several things and nothing has been bad. They are open super late. You have gotta hit this joint if your live in or are visiting Charlotte.

HUuscwzjlY5zoPJVQPn1vg.text: I only went for dessert and coffee.  The lady at the counter asked me if I had any questions about what was in the (huge) dessert case...  haha...  what is this? what is this?  what is this?  what is this? yum.  what is this?  what is this...  Borat, anyone, Borat?  Sitting down I asked to see the menu for future reference...wow and wow.  Diner food for sure, BUT...  I started seeing other people's dinner coming out and WOW!  YUM!  I'm definitely coming back here for dinner...lunch and yes...  BREAKFAST ALL DAY.    Thank you.  I had the Lemon Cream Cake.  I will have the Lemon Cream Cake again, and again and again.    Service was great.  Never a wait for a refill and she always checked in.  I'm sorry I didn't remember her name.

My girlfriend and I went for lunch but she saw French toast on the menu and couldn't resist the urge to indulge. The portions are huge, especially for lunch, so I definitely had a pre-dinner snack that day. The service was excellent as well. Our waiter ensured that our first visit was enjoyable and memorable. If it matters for you...this spot is a police lunchtime hangout. Definitely coming back with friends.
