yH1Fj8q5hjFEk6dk1VShFA.text: Every time I've been here I always see multiple health code violations. The French fries are pretty good but the Reuben made me very ill.

oPoL0Jgb5KiOvSOdLFzrUQ.text: Don't go at shift change between 4:00 - 5:30 PM.  We've been going to the Landmark for over 10 years and this was this first time the food was unacceptable.  We ordered our regular favorites, the chicken tenders dinner and the spanakopita dinner.  We complained and the waitress let us know there are always food problems at shift change in the kitchen.   We ended up sending our food back TWICE.  The chef came out to speak to us and was clueless about what was wrong with our food.    The chicken tenders were cooked too long until they were hard and inedible.  The stuffed baked potato was served burned and blackened.  The spanakopita was overbaked and the so called Greek salad that was supposed to come with it was 2 lettuce leaves with a cube of feta cheese on top of it.  We changed our orders to a Greek salad and the fish sandwich.  The salad was fine because there wasn't anything that they cooked in it.  The fish sandwich was terrible.  The Landmark has now lost 2 of their longtime customers.

GF54zr42ku3EiBmLg5omfw.text: We've eaten here maybe six times in a year.   With the exception of the stale bread basket once, everything else has been pretty good.   Although I must say I'll never order the French toast made with the Challah bread again. It was okay but not as good at the regular French toast. I think they make the Challah french toast with the stale Challah bread.  My daughter loves the chicken cheese "steak".  We have always had excellent service every time we've eaten at Landmark and tip accordingly.

PIRquYNZYfHvHAgWw3ZdxA.text: Checked this place out due to seeing it on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives on Food Network. Menu had a lot of choices. Food was  ahhh....okay. Desserts were worth the trip. Dessert case was overwhelming. Food came out lukewarm as if it was sitting in the back for a while which made the trip a bit disappointing and the waitress was very very slow. I would go back during a time when not so busy and maybe have a different experience. Overall, I've had better Greek food. Worth a try though.

f0wWeGw0i0xJdG2ZYu1q8w.text: My daughter told me about seeing Landmark featured on Guy Fieri's show, so we went to try it out on a Saturday (late breakfast/early lunch). I have to admit, I'm really not sure what the hype was about, food-wise.  Hubby ordered a breakfast combo plate (bacon, eggs, biscuit, grits) and I ordered an omelet with home fries and a biscuit.  First thing's first....NOBODY in the South serves breakfast grits on a plate. Where was the bowl?  Grits grits everywhere, because these grits were on the soupy side.   I'm not sure who forgot about my home fries on the griddle, but I spent more time picking out over-cooked, hard, crusty, un-edible potato pieces out of my food than time spent actually eating the potatoes.  I think whomever was cooking my home fries also cooked my omelet because it was way past well-done too.  Our waitress was fabulous....super friendly, kept our drinks full, spent time with us when we first sat down (since it was our first visit), and was really genuine. :)  Maybe a better experience would have been had if I had dived head-first into the monstrous dessert display case up front.  Needless to say I gained weight just looking at them.  Seating and wheelchair accessibility was *almost* too cramped, but for being there around noon on a Saturday it was tolerable.

fXgy-J_auFa5zK99IPU-eA.text: Food was very good. Service was outstanding. Server Dennis was very attentive & went above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was pleasant.

MvcaJxJfdxyId7SyhlaAvA.text: It was okay. I actually didn't like the food at all and thought it could have been much better. To their credit, I've been told they're known for their food so I will try it again with different results hopefully!

J-U6F14ZmD5Ah0FNKWUkGQ.text: If I didn't know any better, I thought I was back in New Jersey on Route 23. This is a great diner - good food, breakfast all day, big menu with all kinds of selections and a huge glass case with unbelievable desserts. The apple turnovers were HUGE!!! Did I say the deserts were awesome - just like a NY/NJ bakery/diner!!!   The challah French toast was the bomb. And seriously - save room for a dessert. They are all amazing.

ey9FQqb6sD3eLjkcOnO72A.text: Ive been going here  for years never had a problem, decided to go here tonight and had a awful experience. The service was good, the food was good. It wasn't until it was over that the experience became a bad one.  I've never had to pay a gratuity here even in groups , go to other restaurants and it's up to you. Tonight it was a shock to my system me and my child ate each meal no more than 10 dollars and some how I had to pay 31 dollars because of it. Shame shame shame, did I say shame? Really upset it isn't written any where in the restaurant never seen it so I'm really upset.  The service wasn't that good for it to be automatic all of a sudden.  Shame on you landmark, update your menu, decor and bathrooms. And the women at the cash register that greet you and cash you out are horrible. The red head one with glasses really rude, I was talking to her about my order, she didn't want to listen to me the customer she was more interested in talking to the other rude women at the front. Landmark has really changed. Wow

qbcpz1nWHsIvmNA0UTDy8g.text: Not your typical small, greasy diner!! The helpings are big and the food is great!  Lots to choose from & everything was right on time!!

2mFbVIXGagPgtzgVlWWuxg.text: The first two times I went to Landmark, I actually enjoyed it. But the last few times, it was icky and the service was horrible. I ordered a cheeseburger and my husband ordered chicken fingers. How can you mess up a simple cheeseburger and chicken finger? The burger was dry and overcooked, and it was topped with a icky slice of fake cheese. I was disappointed to say the least. The only think I liked was the tuxedo cake. That's always good. But Landmark needs to step it up.

HsTy_clDFCrE2Y2Q2HKRxA.text: Love this place! The staff is excellent. Friendly and efficient. My goto meal is the pork chops breakfast with eggs and grits (see pic). The pork chops are AMAZING. It's like the king of French toasts. Also amazing. I have no complaints about this place. Every time we go we leave happy... and we go a lot lol!

UldJaJ7mlH9rduL745y0Sw.text: I went to Landmark the other day and it was enjoyable.  It is a diner type place and there is a wide array of food to choose from.  I got an omelet and was satisfied.  I don't drink coffee but my friend does and he mentioned that it was surprisingly very good.    Portions are large, price is excellent, and service is good.  I think I need to go back and try some of the more sugary selections to experience all there is to experience at Landmark.

gM7Eu_TUUTL2q46bw8MAOw.text: I've been going to landmark since 1995. They have a good variety of fishes - from Greek to basic sandwiches to meat loaf and other good food . It is always crowded and service is pretty fast . I would def go more often if I it was closer to me now that I moved !! Tip: order the chicken gyro or the meat loaf with their fresh salad - wow..to die for . Prices are just as expected for a diner

EdSrUaC1ldLxXYHTTF4kUA.text: This, is a Real diner. This is definitely one of the places that makes me miss home the most because this is by definition a New York diner. The menu is so large that it might actually beat out the cheesecake factory. But it is those types of things that makes this a real winner for me. Diners are the best in my eyes when you can literally order anything you want from pancakes to a full Thanksgiving meal and then everything in between.

f5ahWVRGBC80-M_0_qFVfw.text: One of Charlotte's best DIners. I've lived in NY and Chicago and have been to many and this compares. Brings back memories every time I dine here.

ZARQEf6OtOi1PBm9wk6B2w.text: Food was good. The spanish chic that waited on me was the worst service I have ever got in a server!  We had to chase down another waitress to get a take out box.  No how is the food?  No would you like a desert?  There are hundreds of restaurants in charlotte pick another one with descent service!

bKCL9i_n_mLGIQkjnZB1IQ.text: I used to be a regular customer at Landmark when I lived in Charlotte. So when I visited this past week, this was my first stop. I was so disappointed. As soon as you walk in you an tell that the atmosphere has changed. The staff is not as friendly. We ordered sodas. I had to send mine back twice because they were flat. Our orders came with bread and salads. We never received them. Two of us ordered the Italian Trio. It was awful! It was cold and tasteless. When I mentioned it to the manager i was told that they cant season the food because they have elderly customers. I guess the other customers don't count. I'm not sure if they're under new management but this restaurant has really gone down. And I think they need to stop using the Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives thing to get customers. That was way back when they were good.

I-XLd8UJymkLbOx7-0CfpA.text: Restaurant had a horrible smell when we first enter on July 11 ,2015, around ,1am there was a wait about 10min, we where  not offered water after being seated or anything, couple menus dirty , our waitress was more attentive to all male table then ours, 3 women and served cold coffee. The wings were over priced and the plate was dirty, brought it to the waitress attention, she apologize and went to the other tables, the other ladies order omelettes, no cheese, hardly no meat and flat with little taste, everything was charged as a side order, the bacon was cold. I just gave up, the waitress never came, so had to go to front area for a box and notice the desserts, so wanted to try the chocolate layer cake, very thin slice and the price was a 6dllrs for the cake, now the waitress box the dessert and we when I went to pay for my food told the cashier I didn't want the cake, she questioned why I did explain portion size and she took the box cake and threw it on the side area where their joke of bar was.  Will never return here again, everyone gave good reviews, but it's a horrible diner, should had stayed at the Midnite Diner, but the line was so long, sometimes it's better to wait, even if it was a mile long, then you know this Diner must have been good.

Apx-DL9ccUgWGKqlDZqPvw.text: Food Network Fail. Horrible service, had to ask server FOUR times for SILVERWARE. Meal took an hour and fifteen minutes after being seated. Requested cocktail sauce, received barbecue sauce. Fries were served cold. Fish sandwich was full of bones and served on a stale bun. Very disappointing.

17GY7q8gwGX4eLfYdhBWTA.text: Outdated and mediocre, did not live up to the Diners Drives and Dives hype.  Wouldn't eat there again although it wasn't terrible.  Service was also average.

HUb2LDx_nrja3-QEBJF0Uw.text: Food was pretty good (I had a chicken wrap) but service was crazy slow.  Our party of 3 (after the main lunch rush) didn't even get acknowledged by a server for almost 15 minutes...just as we were about to give up and leave.  Even then, it wasn't a server, it was one of the runners who informed us who our server was and that he would take our drink orders.  We had him take our food orders as well.  A harried young lady I can only assume was our server - she never introduced herself or apologized for making us wait - brought us our food pretty quickly after we ordered it.  It was good and the portions were more than I could eat.  I'll give it another shot at some point.

Ol9YoArDLPqPs93TSRARzA.text: Gotta love the landmark! We do take out breakfast or lunch here a few times a month. Did lunch today and had the meatloaf parmigiana. If you like meatloaf you will love this dish. 2 huge slabs of meatloaf, that on it's own are very good, topped with tomato sauce and cheese. It is meatloaf heaven. I think they only have this on Tues. but not sure.  I also love the marinated beef tips over rice, and you can't go wrong with breakfast. They serve home fries instead of shredded hash browns most places serve.

KdoKAL-dkp1QBcWQUR6Erw.text: Good breakfast spot off central. Eggs sloppy in a good way, toast is on point. Great service!

fO6IhqMd1uaRgsaotSirLA.text: I ordered a lasagna with garlic bread to go and when I got home and sat down to eat I realized that the garlic bread was missing. I called back and (Sandra) answered with a very disrespectful tone claiming she was the only manager working (first lie) and saying that I should have asked for the garlic bread because it does not come with the lasagna (second lie) and when I asked to be compensated she said bring back the food and we'll make you a fresh lasagna and make sure to give you garlic bread.. (THIRD LIE) .. When I arrived at the restaurant Sandra was very unprofessional and rude. She said she could not replace my food and she could only give me the garlic bread.  THE ONLY REASON I LEFT HAPPY and gave 4 stars: is because the very kind and professional chef that seemed like he knew the owners. He listened to what I had to say and replaced my meal without any problems. Thank you very much chef, and I hope Sandra gets fired ASAP she is an idiot.

9nBXB8rDQ5R8L775bNdjvg.text: Landmark never disappoints. We go here once a week and enjoy huge portions( guarantee lunch the next day) & friendly service. Must grab sweets when you go out the door. Give this place a try...

_vauvJ2u39qo8gj6mYMBbg.text: The service is usually good, sometimes a little slow when its busy. The food is usually pretty good. I like their Greek foods and their burger and sandwich fare. They have a huge menu with breakfast lunch and dinner items always available. The main selling point for Landmark Diner is their deserts. The deserts are huge and decadent. You won't be disappointed by the deserts so leave room.

oTuX6kzpy_7I-YL5KQZ8Cw.text: After hearing a lot about this place I decided to stop by. The menu, like many Greek owned restaurants, is MASSIVE. It took me awhile to figure out what I wanted but I ended up just getting a cheeseburger and onion rings. The portion was huge but it was good. The hours are the thing that really sets this place apart. I went here around 10:30pm and the place was packed. Best restaurant in Charlotte for a late night bite. Good food, big portions, excellent value. Definitely recommend!

zhZRnZyo5w7XttmkvwTTIg.text: Landmark is absolutely amazing. .im eating the chicken Alfredo and its sooooooo goooooood..

fbYOFmD9NjrIK8-LwshHoA.text: Every city has a number of diners, some more than others. Everyone living in that city swears loyalty to one of those diners-- whether because their family has always gone there, or there's a favorite menu item, or its in the right spot. This is my diner, and let me tell you why:  Awesome crowd. Church goers, large families, little old ladies, yuppies, hipsters-- everyone eats here. The time you go has some bearing on who you'll see, but I've seen a gramma in her sunday best chowing down on a stack of pancakes at 1 am, as well as a group of biker-dudes grabbing some early breakfast on a saturday. Very entertaining.  Huge menu. An essential for an awesome diner is having pages and pages of ameri-greek specials mixed with stand-by burgers, omelettes, fries, salad platters, short stacks. Landmark has it all.  Hours. Anytime you want a waffle, you can find one here. Always open, always politely staffed, and with an early-bird menu that takes an extra dollar off their already reasonably priced breakfast specials (my go-to is the Garden-- tons of veggies in a three-egg omelette, grits, biscuit or toast for $5.95), there's no reason for me to go anywhere else.   Nothing here is blow-you-away. But that isn't what diners are for. I come here because its comfy, the staff is terrific, the food is consistent and cheap, and I know I'll get exactly what I came for: a quick, cheap, decent meal.  Note: rumor has it they're "experimenting" with a house veggie burger (none on the menu yet). Might just bump 'em up a star once they start serving it, since the only issue I ever have is the small selection of veggie-friendly options in that massive menu.

jtW_0lYXrtcq36YqCaSllw.text: Being from Philadelphia and experiencing great diners growing up, I was saddened to move to Raleigh, NC and find we don't have a good diner here. So after watching a diner's drive in and dives show, which featured this establishment, we decided to give it a try once we visited Charlotte. The Neighborhood is "sketchy" at best... I was a little worried about the outside not being much to look at. So imagine my suprise once inside to see the dessert case with (gasp) tasty and large treats to try. We went for dinner, and as Guy had suggested I tried the turkey dinner. It was lip smackin' good- as they like to say in the south. I fell in love instantly with this place.Just to be sure I wasn't dreaming about a good diner in the south, we came back the next morning for breakfast..and the dream became a reality. Our breakfast was just as tasty, and now every visit to Charlotte requires at least one- or two- stops at the Landmark Diner!

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

ILwjjq5t_yu7wXO_GgUtFA.text: Found egg shells in my scrambled eggs. They put wax paper on top of my cheese on top of my grits and when I peeled it back, all the cheese came off. I'll probably eat here again but I'll check everything before I bite into anything.

Er6K7Af01HkIBe8uCrh82Q.text: Being from NYC I have had the pleasure of enjoying a authentic Diner, this place isn't even close. They have some of the right items on the menu but the quality of the food is bad.

cakFCoH2GRk4ruFUz2kTWw.text: When it's after midnight, and I'm looking for something to eat, I find myself drawn to the Landmark like a moth to flame. The place is grubby in the way that only a 24 hour diner can accomplish, but it's a grubby I've come to love.  The staff is friendly when it's not too busy, and you can expect them to want to chat.   The menu is giant...it's like 2 feet tall and 15 pages long. You can get breakfast at midnight or have dinner at 6 a.m. The dinner and lunch entrees vary from Greek and Italian home-style specialties to classic American diner grub (burgers, steaks, fries, etc.)  Since I do the vegetarian thing, my favorites are the breakfast items and the Spanakopita. The Spanakopita dish comes with a lovely Greek side salad. I also like their stuffed grape leaves, even though I'm pretty sure that they came out of a jar.   Their cakes and pies are a little prettier than they are delicious, but really, even a pie that isn't perfect is still a delicious pie...You just can't go wrong with cake and sugary frosting. I tend to forgo the desserts, however, to save more room inside my guts for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The bread is fabulous.
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mmmmm feta!
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bread, with finger. The finger&#39;s not on the menu.

LIJONMeZD3VaFAR2KK-Y_w.text: Roasted Tom Turkey. It's like a Thanksgiving meal, very filling and tasty. I had enough to take away for another meal. Service was good as well. The desserts were large and sweet.

CxP7BNkH_ZY0cTDFg6h95w.text: Called a to-go order in last night around 12:30 am. I thought I would make it easy so I ordered two of the exact same breakfast. 2 eggs over medium, sausage patties and french toast. Eggs cooked perfect. French toast some battered and some not. Sausage patties? They gave me one order and they were way overcooked. Sausage probable sat all day and they only had one order so instead of cooking fresh order they gave me only one order.  The food is good for what it is but check your to-go orders carefully

Q6_7ajBdwCx3R2LlexDPsQ.text: In my search for the perfect gyro I came upon Landmark (mainly because the first two places I went to were closed). I knew that keeping with the Greek/diner theme, a gyro would be on the menu. The place is no frills and is reminiscent of your run of the mill New York diner. Sadly, the gyro was mediocre. The meat had little flavor and was dry. What really got me was that the gyro sandwich was served as a platter. No lettuce, tomato, onion adornment here, just a flat lifeless combination of  meat and pita. I'm still looking for that gyro I can pick up with my hands and slowly tear at the paper as I sink my teeth into a mother load of spiced meat and tzatziki. I'll let you know when I find it.

lDw5XnnGIxs5hw-XSljcTg.text: After years of wanting to check this place out, I finally headed down Central Ave. I arrived at 11:15 and the placed was packed. I joined those waiting and watched as the disarray of settings took place. After being seated, I waited, at my dirty table, over 10 minutes before even being approached. I ordered the Sunday Turkey, Gravy, and Stuffing Special, with mashed potatoes and corn as the sides. I was offered bread and said yes. The bread was stale and cold. As I waited over 20 minutes I admired the dirty floors and rude servers. My dish was finally delivered and looked like a mound of gravy, and was cold. I asked to have it reheated and was given a not-so-friendly look. Once I was able to dive in the stuffing had no flavor and was so soggy. The turkey was okay, but destroyed with the "out of the can" yellow gravy. The mashed potatoes and corn were okay, but I can imagine the corn was frozen. Definitely disappointed and will not return.

ra4DilA_EuD1J-euwi27IQ.text: I have been going to Landmark since my friends introduced me to it in 1995.  Back then it use to be open 24 hours.  It was the place to go after the bars and clubs.  The menu is HUGE!  So much to choose from!!  Great breakfast anytime of the day.  And not to forget the dessert case!!  So many delicious things you just have to get a couple!  But my favorite is to get the basket of onion rings with ranch dressing for an appetizer.  I ususally try to go on a Saturday night.  One of their specials is chicken pot pie and I love it!!!  The service there is always on point and wonderful!  If you're in the need for some good, naughty food stop in and check it out!

XzwI5VM1SjsssR3unljKNQ.text: Um, well, wow, everything is giant-sized here! Maybe its just culture shock after spending the last year in Japan and coming back on vacay, but geez, I wasn't expecting an entire watershed's worth of seafood when I ordered the fried flounder and calabash shrimp platter. I found it a bit on the bland side, but nothing the tartar sauce couldn't fix. The onion rings were also bland on the flavour front, maybe they should spice the batter they use a bit more. Fries and slaw were okay as sides, but given the H-U-G-E amount of food that I ended up with I really couldn't get too excited about it.  I couldn't manage to get dessert down at the restaurant but I got a slice of carrot cake to go and that was excellent the next day.  Three stars tentatively due to that delicious cake, and since its probably my fault for ordering fried seafood at a diner instead of actual diner food, but I'm saving my first back to the US burger for Cookout.

WJ5sNs9L37edF00Gec110g.text: Normally I wouldn't make this public.  Saturday afternoon.  we ate at the Landmark Diner in Charlotte.  Got a slice of banana cream pie to go. While eating at home something tasted funny.  So I spit out the bit that I had in my mouth and looked close at the pie.  This wasnt a tiny piece of mold it was over a 1/4 inch thick.  Called the restaurant and asked to speak to manager.  They were gone for the day.  I asked one to call me back and still have not recieved a call back.  That was 3 days ago.

4Ivggubs5pMKIIEd00CLOw.text: Landmark Diner is a truly exceptional establishment! Having lived in New York for several years I am a total diner addict, and when I walk into Landmark I am transported back to New York. Landmark prepares food comparable to the great diners I frequented back then, with a super affordable price point--less expensive than other Charlotte diners!  For me, diners always mean breakfast, whether its morning, afternoon, or night! Landmark offers all of the traditional breakfast fare, i.e. various egg preparations, pancakes, home fries, steak and eggs, but then expands the menu with more creative options. On my first visit our server recommended challah french toast, a thick cut slab of challah bread, coated in a seasoned egg mixture and cooked to perfection on the stovetop. The dish was fabulous; the bread was golden and crispy on the outside and melt-in-your-mouth gooey goodness inside. My partner ordered pork chops and eggs, which were perfectly cooked, succulent and flavorful.  Landmark Diner was featured on Guy Fieri's TV series, "Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives," and it is very clear why the producers selected this spot. The food is delicious, the portions are huge, and the prices are surprisingly affordable. Landmark Diner absolutely made its mark on me, as I have a new Queen City favorite!

93A7DUA_zHuh0jCJ3qlqVw.text: Landmark has a great Ruben sandwich! The corn beef is great and they have amazing fries! I would recommend the fries well done. It is also very quick service which is great if you are short on time. They also have great gyros! Their tzatziki is amazing as well!

NjSumNx4ALhLQHpCwrXt8Q.text: Landmark has great food! The corn beef is great and they have amazing fries! I would recommend the fries well done. It is also very quick service which is great if you are short on time. They also have great gyros! Their tzatziki is great as well. I have been for breakfast a few times and I feel as it is just average for breakfast. They have a great lunch/dinner menu that is large with a huge selection of different styles of food. I have never had their dessert but it looks amazing!

nyjnAsS46mnHfYaxvksnNA.text: If you are craving it...they have it! This place has big portions, so it's okay to share.

p2-f-E4pm8QcceOXrM4FMw.text: Service was wonderful, Aeisha was excellent at helping us for our first time experience at this diner. She even told me what her favorites were, including some that were not on the menu.  Tour of Italy, was a bit dry. But she brought me extra sauce.  I requested garlic bread instead of the regular bread, she would kindly brought it to me and it was really good.  A grilled sandwich on marbled rye with roast beef and grilled onions and cheese was very good.     Desserts, homemade in the basement of the restaurant, and they looked great! However we were full enough from all the large portions that we got desserts to go.

_yj8ZlxwpB248ZV-Mzvx7w.text: I love Landmark. I always have and probably always will. Obviously the desserts are amazing, but the service is always good too. I'm a big fan of the philly cheese steak myself. I've been going for years and typically have birthdays there.

vi_va9B-tIdtTMAbL9hTvA.text: So normally I don't make complaints or write reviews due to the fact that I am in this industry and understand that are many variables that come in to play when your meal just doesn't go right but in all in my years of eating out and working in this industry I have never come across an establishment that doesn't replace food or let you exchange it when it is not of good quality. Unfortunately tonight we experienced being told by our server that it isn't  something they do, upon requesting to see the coward that owns the establishment, only to be told he will not come out and speak with he only speaks through his employees. I will never eat here again. Anyone who treats their guest and employees like trash doesn't deserve anyone's money. That is not how business is done. I truly feel sorry for his employees.

DbwjsBNM2IrbuacuCF5lxA.text: I have been eating at Landmark since I was a kid. My family has been going to this place for as long as I can remember. However, over the years the service has gotten a bit bad. The owners are friendly but the staff are another story. They just hang around the area where I think they roll silverware which to me is unprofessional when customers are in the building. Ive noticed employees being on their cellphones when business is busy. Alot of the staff dont appear happy to be at their job and it shows in their interaction with customers. Ive heard them gossiping and being unprofessional when I've gotten takeout. It kind of sucks because Landmark WAS one of my favorite places to dine, especially with the homemade deserts but I prefer not dining at a place with front end staff that are so unprofessional.

R4_-OLbWgypMoct_eP-iNg.text: Don't go here if you don't want great food. The portions are big, fresh and so good. Our server his evening was James. We highly recommend if you go ask for this guy. Very professional and personable . He made sure our food and drinks were good several times. We have gone here several times over we the years and it's always been great !  Food is great as ever and several new wait staff. We have had Gavin, Jose and Teresa and they are just the BEST !!! We usually ask for one of them because they are just top notch.

c34rva15OrqNqlQlNPYHew.text: My husband said this used to be the place back in the day. He took me here for the first time last week. It's a cute little diner with friendly staff. There is a lot of items to choose from on the menu. Too much if you ask me. I ordered the chicken Alfredo pasta, broccoli and mushrooms. My husband got the shrimp Alfredo pasta. Our meal both came with a side salad. The food was extremely bland. Not seasoned at all. Chicken was tough and my husband said that the shrimp tasted old. I will not be going back there. We didn't try the deserts. Although, the deserts did look really good sitting in the display case.

x90VmrdZaoh-M6UJDW4VmQ.text: This is an every Sunday kind of love. You will make friends, and everyone will know your name.  This food is #home

Gd4mIBTOz0csc3HvdlNXnQ.text: I absolutely love this place! I first heard of it when I was dating a man from New Jersey and he told me to come here with him, I won't regret it, and it is as close to a Jersey diner I can get to here in the south.  Now, I have been coming here for almost 4 years now. Breakfast is amazing, there is something on the menu for everyone. I personally love the country ham with breakfast, it reminds me of home in rural Eastern Carolina. Breakfast is served constantly and the desserts are absolutely divine, and once again, there is something for everyone of all ages in the dessert case.  This review is only missing one star because I have been a handful of times where service hasn't been A+ but more like a B, but generally service is adequate.

vlg1NeD0jv2bZv1V_qA32Q.text: Late night out with friends, a night of drinking, fun and (fill in the blank) . After a night of fun, it's time to feed the beast and a friend recommended Landmark which i never knew existed but what a gem . We typically go to another spot to remain nameless which is out of the way small and always packed with subpar food. Landmark's food was good, came out quick and our waiter was attentive.   Ordered the Steak & Eggs ordered medium which is the only way to order and eat steak . Steak came out well done which I didn't expect Ruth Chris quality but was hoping to have a bit of red but oh well I needed food and Landmark delivered. Friends ordered Ham and a pancake/turkey sausage plate which both said were delicious and hit the spot. We'll definitely be back based on our experience, the location and of course prices.   There is a key lime pie with my name on it so to be continued.

1TEmofNcyuHVfcadSDJ1xw.text: Dined at this restaurant on Christmas Eve and we were able to be seated immediately.   The menu was massive. Breakfast is served all day so total there are 3 sections to choose from. They also have daily specials so make sure to inquire about that.   The food was served quick! Everyone's meal was good. The chalks French toast is definitely recommended!

Very disappointed in the food and cleanliness this time. Definitely not what it used to be. Kudos to the friendly , helpful waitress .

Ghbf31tu5xK8x9eXeIzZMw.text: The Landmark is your classic Greek owned diner. Great home cooked southern meals. Because Greeks are the only people who know how to cook southern food anymore. The landmark has stood the test of town as east Charlotte has evolved from a white middle class enclave to the most ethically diverse part of Charlotte. We mainly go here for their massive desserts. Some are as good as they look and others aren't so be choosy

Well today i got there early enough to beat the rush lol.   I had the Omega special, which is two eggs any style, sausage,bacon, and three pancakes. Overall, i enjoyed the meal. It was decent. My favorite was the pancakes. The reason i say "decent" is because my eggs were a little dry and my bacon a bit over cooked.   All in all, i think I'll come back. ad0B1zKNESJe3xmlhc-JVw.text: Good food, great prices, very large portions. A great place to come for a late night dinner or very early breakfast after a night out on the town. Parking can be a bear, but worth it. A staple in my dining out.

ZA1YbqfXkTfyc5VIm82xtQ.text: I am a lover of diner food (real diner food...unless I'm in a pinch, you can keep your Waffle House). And Landmark is the real deal.  1. I've been for breakfast, dinner, and late night and the food is killer all the way around. It's not 4 diamond or anything, but that's not what this place is. As far as diner fare goes, these guys set the standard. The French toast is excellent, and their Greek selections are pretty great, too.  And the dessert case. My word, the dessert case. I ordered an eclair on a late-night dessert run and the thing came to me on a full-size dinner plate.  2. They are open until 4am. In Charlotte. No further explanation needed.  3. This place is great for people watching. Awkward teenage dates? Yep. Bikers? Of course. Little old ladies fanning themselves after church? Why not. And they are all welcomed and happily coexist at the Landmark.   Are you still reading? Haven't lost you yet? Well, why not? Stop it! Go to the Landmark.

QvHbwM52Fu5D3j8vrfUtIg.text: I'm giving the Landmark 4 stars because of their delicious Mousaka. It took a while but that was because they made it fresh, and man was it YUMMY! One of the only places in Charlotte that serve Mousaka, which is the Greek version of Lasagna...only better (IMHO). Oh, and the Greek desserts were very yummy as well, like their Baklava.  But, what my Dad and Wife had were just OK, nothing special. I warned my Dad about ordering Pastrami from a non-Jewish deli, and sure enough, it was not very good. Somewhat dry. My wife had the Chicken Souvlaki which were decent but not great.  They have a large menu and I will try something different next time just to see what else they do.  But if you go, go GREEK! That Mousaka was oh so very delicious!

6UJdbIo9I7OLBLX8hoSsOw.text: This is what you'd think of when you think "old school diner". It is a great place for someone who's not sure what they want to eat, as they have all day breakfast, Italian, seafood, burgers, deli sandwiches, steaks, soups, turkey dinners, etc. The staff is always amazing and incredibly friendly. We have never had a bad server. If you are someone who likes desert, this needs to be a destination point. There is a whole case of cakes and the slices are gigantic. Not a fancy place, but great for those who love diners.

HishCztO43QnQ8yL9lTA8A.text: I love this place. The young Tom turkey plate is my meal of choice, but to be fair I've never had anything that wasn't good from the landmark. The interior is a little dated, but the food is good and the staff is friendly. They have a case full of desserts, all beautiful and tasty.. I recommend you at least attempt to save room for dessert.

3KBnAgnlFnFdhaa15EmJRA.text: The very best Turkey and Dressing I have Ever had (sorry, Mom!). The turkey was tender and moist, and along with the delicious stuffing and gravy, practically melted in my mouth.  I love that they're open so late! The wait staff were very attentive and helpful.  Huge menu, beautiful house-made desserts.  I look forward to eating there again next time I'm in Charlotte.

XJGQA5zOou9ijFjRQr3RyA.text: I'm pretty dang excited to have discovered Landmark. Why? Well, come with me as I explain.  Landmark is not quite within the borders of the trendy part of Central Avenue. You shouldn't let the fact that its in a less exciting area deter you, however. Not that people seem to be deterred. When we went for Sunday brunch, there was an amazing mix of customers (as others have noted). Old ladies in church clothes, hipsters in Chucks, families with kids, and all of a range of ethnicity and color. This, to me, is an excellent sign.   Inside, the place is nicer than you'd expect. It's not fancy by any stretch of the imagination, but it's clean, the decorations are fairly tasteful, and it's spacious. We were promptly seated and served drinks, and service was excellent throughout our meal.  Of course, you're probably more interested in the food than the clientele, decor, or service. Well, you're in luck, because it was quite tasty. I ordered the Farmer's omelette, which included sausage, bacon, and tons of veggies. It was delicious. The biscuit that came with it was done right as well. The only "meh" note were the home fries, which, despite being nice and crispy, were slightly bland. Salt and pepper helped. Yeah, the food isn't word class, but it's plentiful, tastes good, and is cheap. I can't wait to go back and pick something out from that huge dessert case.  All of the above are excellent reasons to give a restaurant four stars. What pushes me all the way to five? They're open at 4AM folks. 4AM. If you live in Mint Hill, you'll understand why it makes me so happy to have a place fairly close by, open late and serving good food, that's not Cookout.  4AM!

gKNtGoaO1rPIFz8A4DKm2Q.text: I stopped in here for dinner with a friend while on a trip to Charlotte and the food was pretty good. The service wasn't bad either. The building seems a little small and when there are a lot of people there it can feel a tad cramped, but otherwise the atmosphere wasn't too bad. I liked Landmark Diner and would eat there again if given the chance.

TzeP9m32cO7DHsSMjrmX8A.text: Terribly disappointing. Our food was lukewarm and that bothers me. spanakopita was soggy and barely warm. Ribeye steak sandwich was tasteless. The bread on the sandwich was tough. Beware, before your meal arrives, they bring you leftover challah bread that is stale, not warm and no butter. I didn't waste time on that garbage. Husband had a hot roast beef sandwich. Roast beef was tough. Service is slow. Checkout is ridiculous. Same person that is Running the register also has to pack all desserts that are ordered to go.

WInTlzA1aEa6jPIeO9cz_w.text: Great service and great food. The desert was amazing and the portions are so big!

sXvLUztM8RtpulYMbj1Dkg.text: Don't ask me why or how I've lived in Charlotte almost all my life and I JUST now tried this place. What was I waiting for?? The dessert/bakery case is enough to give Amelie's a run for their money. Their menu is as big as The Cheesecake Factory, but way easier to read. Of course, when in Rome, do as the Romans do, so I ordered a gyro platter. Delish. We also got the stuffed grape leaves appetizer and honestly, that was big enough for a meal. Our server was on point, friendly and knowledgeable. I can't wait for my next visit!

bsCa5XbLnGSSglgDuRjllg.text: Ate there late night, around 3:00am. I was not impressed at all. The service was okay, nothing to rave about but the server was nice and the food came out pretty quick. I ordered buffalo chicken wings with ranch & cheese grits. The wings came out dry with the sauce on the side which was odd to me because I didn't ask for them that way. The buffalo wing sauce was not good at all. It was VERY salty with a bad after taste. The ranch was bland so it didn't mask the bad sauce taste. The cheese grits were average. I've heard the omelettes are great, but overall I was pretty underwhelmed.

eDXFXYgx02C8zaF_7XIJKw.text: I was nervous about this place after reading so many negative reviews, but it really was a great first experience. I got the boiled turkey breast smothered in gravy with stuffing,  which were out of this world. My girlfriend got the country fried chicken with home fries, also both delicious, but the home fries were way under seasoned. We managed to save room for dessert and got the tuxedo cake (white and chocolate mousse cake) -- absolutely delicious. The reason I gave this place a 4 was cause our waitress didn't seem to like her job and wasn't very friendly. Will definitely eat there again.

Hpg04ss873yxCqsUwNIBjQ.text: Comfort food galore and with so many choices your bound to find a few favorites. My wife and son love the Tom Turkey dinner and I'm very fond of the pork souvlaki. Pastries are off the chart and the value is on point.

Mz7CDMTVF6PbU2b8XV52Dg.text: Going down hill fast. We have been here numerous times but had a couple month break because of a poor visit our previous time. The host was a pleasant gentleman who was very responsive and courteous. Went here with a  party of five yesterday for an after graduation meal. The menu remains a typical NY/NJ diner style BIG menu with plenty to choose from but what is coming off of the menu is definitely not worthy of a decent NY/NJ diner.  Two of us order breakfast, two order lunch meals and one ordered a sandwich. No one was satisfied. Coffee was barely luke warn, egg selections were burnt because of their grill being too hot. The sausage links we burnt and chewy because they were cooked hours previously and just re-heated. One had a Philly cheese steak sandwich which was totally flavorless. Another had beef tips over rice that tasted like Uncle Ben's rice. All this and a waitress with a crappy attitude.  Sorry Landmark... time for us to find another "Go to" place.

3DN5CUcLvuOYQg5PN2LMoQ.text: This is a hidden spot in Charlotte...my favorite is the lasagna and chicken pot pie.. breakfast can be bought anytime..

fA9kO2H8eVjU_06qoQe6Tw.text: My husband and I went for breakfast before he had to go to work. I dont know if it was very early but the staff was not really nice. They barely spoke or made any conversation. I saw them on yelp and they had a few good reviews I just wanted to try them for myself. The food was ok but I dont think we'll be going back.

ni4HLxWAPoZHKPpb9AFdwA.text: Landmark, where have you been all my life? This place is amazing! Can't believe I haven't been there before. We got there and got seated really fast, it was not crazy like some restaurants where there is a huge line you have to wait and our waitress was super nice and attentive. She helped me look thru the menu since I couldn't find what I was looking for (the spanakopita). Now to the food, WOW! so much better than I expected. So GOOD!!! I loved every single thing. I got the spanakopita with a Greek salad and broccoli. Those portions are HUGE! I thought I had ordered an extra salad by mistake lol. The salad was delicious! With the most delicious feta cheese and fresh veggies. Then my main meal came, I couldn't be happier! My boyfriend had a gyro and he said it was one of the best he's had. Portions where also great. We got the check and loved what we saw. Half of the amount we usually pay while eating out, and we liked this place so much better. I'm giving it 5 stars. Amazing service, food and prices!!! (I recommend getting the spanakopita when you go).

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyro.
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spanakopita. Amazing!!!
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The delicious Greek salad that came with my meal.

iGYXm2moB80bCzGkCY7LMg.text: Meh. That pretty much sums up my experience at Landmark Diner. We went for brunch after seeing this place on an old episode of Diners, Drive-ins and Dives. None of the food was above average, and some was certainly sub-par. My wife's scrambled eggs were over cooked, and my fried eggs were under cooked. I'd heard they have the best biscuits in Charlotte, but ours were very brown and a little dry. We won't be going back.

QIJvv4TO9Eo6LP8nBT53CQ.text: Beautiful interior. The plate I had was disappointing, but I'd give it another try cause my boyfriend was very pleased with his gyros. Good prices and service. I need to try dessert next time.

CfNvTQLg2Pi0GPjLohC1ow.text: I have been dining at the Landmark for decades. I lived away for a while, and when I returned, not only were they  still going strong, the place had a refresh and the food was even better than I remembered.   I frequently eat the Greek salad. The salad is fresh and generous. The stuffed grape leaves are excellent, but the star of the show is the Greek dressing. That dressing could make a Croc edible.  I almost forgot the best part. Just inside the dining room doors, is a glass display case filled with the most beautiful and sinfully delicious cakes, pies and pastries. I normally am able to visit in the evening, so i like to get something from there to go and have dessert and coffee for breakfast the next day  Good value, crazy selection and great food. And you can get breakfast any time.

GSbAJoFZ2oOze8638TxFSQ.text: Met some buddies here for breakfast on Saturday and had a great meal and even better service. Never had to ask for a coffee refill and the food was solid. Decent prices for diner food and definitely a local staple.  Pretty cool to hear and see that many of the folks working there know the people that come in and sit with them to have a quick conversation.

SG61S7cqjpRdxAZgS2FqNA.text: Love it! I've been here a couple of times and love the food.  Their lamb chops, steak, mushroom crab cakes and fries are delicious!! You do have emphasise how you want your steak as we had to send back one that was over cooked. They have a huge dessert case and make the cakes on site. The cakes are flavourful and moist. I had an ombre purple cake and a tuxedo one, nothing to complain about there...other than they disappeared pretty fast!  The tiramisu is also amazing!! You can taste the espresso which I love!!  The only thing I didn't like was the salmon omelette. The salmon tasted like it was farm raised while the home fries were more like boiled chunks of potatoes.  It's usually packed on Sundays so you might have to wait a while but it's definitely worth it! We also haven't met an unfriendly waitress/waiter which worth mentioning, considering how busy they always are when I've been there.

iITkONtUJNzQYfuGdJpCPQ.text: What's not to like about the Landmark Diner, it's simple amazing! We went out for dinner and couldn't help but indulge in some amazing food. The diner has a wide range of food on their menu and daily specials. You can choose from Greek and Italian food, right to you classic diner Americana food. I ordered the Italian trio which was fettuccine alfredo, chicken parmesan, and a piece of lasagna. Everything was delicious and here they don't skimp out on portion sizes. I was so full I had to take half of it home. However, (please take this tip)save room for dessert! We ordered the huge slice of chocolate cake which was rich, moist, and simply delicious! And to top everything off, we had an amazing server by the name of Scott who truly made the dining experience very special!  I love this place and will definitely be back for some amazing grub!

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

jr3d4-DefD7lb0HAIcEWQw.text: Whoever the staff is inside are extremely unprofessional and rude. My boyfriend and I went there after a long night at work and the waiter decided to be an asshole twice! Once when asking for my drink and the second time when I attempted to order my food AFTER he HAD already brought my boyfriend HIS salad!!! I at THAT point wasn't even hungry anymore and he tried to apologize but the damage was done. I'll be ordering to go if I even order at all!

AoPxEeOfM5sGPw5Oiqes2w.text: Don't let the location deter you from experiencing great food and friendly atmosphere. This place has been here for 25 years and is still going strong. With home desserts that's made out of love you must try to top off your experience. The food came out fast and your cup is never empty. I will be back to experience more food.

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Home fries, Turkey Sausage, Scramble Eggs with Cheese and Hot Cakes
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet potato cheesecake

oKOi7SrAdzkiikLFkf_d3Q.text: This place isn't fine dining.  This is diner food.  The Landmark is one of the few remaining local Charlotte establishments left.  The food is pretty good at a very reasonable price.     The place appears clean and a sanitation grade of 96.0 is posted as soon as you walk in the door.  A hostess will seat you.  My server was prompt to take my drink order and ask if I had any questions.  I ordered from the lunch menu.  There were some good lunch deals to chose from.  I selected the fried flounder sandwich with a side of sweet potatoes.  I made a good choice.  The sandwich was goo but it came with lettuce and tomato instead of slaw.  I would have rather had a little slaw but the tartar sauce was good.  The sweet potatoes were really great.  My meal costed me $8.12.  That is a good price for what I received.     On a side note:  The desserts at this place are on a completely different level.  I have come here before just for dessert!  They have a cooled display case with lots of freshly made cakes and greek desserts and even pastries.

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish sandwich with a side of sweet potatoes.

rIEwEhUEv5Wfezf4OePHCA.text: Great place to have breakfast with the family, We were greeted with a great big hug and our waiter Jose was very good to us. Landmark Diner is a very friendly place for breakfast and the menu selection is very broad. now my only place for breakfast in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast with the Sisters

EbmXGm8zztFTfIlpXVpVTA.text: I have loved this place since I can remember way before diners drive ins and dives. They have great diner style food with a home cooked meal. Have you seen the deserts they have? WOW! They are all good too. I've had just about everything here from the italian trio to every blue plate special. Places like this also seem to have the best ranch and that's True for here. I love dipping the fried squash in some good homemade ranch dressing. It does get super busy so I tend to go not during the rush hours. I also get take out here often. Call ahead and it's ready when you arrive. The staff is always super nice and it does feel like home every time I go in. Thanks Landmark!

Jz8gqtxd9Din1qGyyb7rZQ.text: Ok...ate dinner here yesterday evening, was greeted and taken to a booth down here from there was seated at 8:15 no one came to the table after I"ve seen 2 waitresses in the area neither one came to my table i got up and went to the front after waiting 20 minutes...I say to the hostess do I not hv an waitress for my table she responded no one been to ur table & she  apologized the waitress finally came to table she apologetic as well if it wasn't so late I would hv left but I was tired and hungry I ordered, food was good just didnt start off at well at all..I've never had a problem here and I come here often usually for lunch...and I'm always a good tipper so for me to tip just 10% u know had to be mediocre probably wont be back.

3F8Y_P6xljrwwxIAa6Q7cg.text: Me: I'll do the ribs special with green beans and broccoli.  Waiter: getting your greens in, that's what's up.   This how it started and made my night lol. The food was standard diner food and was pretty good.  I live around the corner from here, so I'll probably be back in the future.

CpCr7sfAXCNYW3-FCu_ZLg.text: Reasonable prices. Good atmosphere. Friendly staff. Large portions. This is pretty much the basis of the restaurant. I was very excited when I found out Guy Fieri from DDD had dined here and filmed it on his show. After I ate the food I was disappointed. The only issue I had with the food was that it did not have enough flavor. I had to add salt to make the food taste like anything. I ordered the Chicken Cordon Bleu with green beans and mashed potatoes. The chicken cordon bleu did not need any additional seasoning. As a matter of fact that was the best thing on my plate. The concession around the table was pretty much the same, the food is lacking flavor.   The green beans were terrible. Aside from them not having any flavor they had something like tomatoes, onions and maybe a potato in the mix. It was too much going on in the green beans for me to enjoy. The mashed potatoes needed salt too but I think they had a few mushrooms pieces in it so I didn't have to add a whole lot of salt to the dish to make it better. We did not order any desert but based on what was on display it looked like it might have been good. Even the display pieces looked like a good sized portion. I was in North Carolina  for the day and decided to give Landmark a try. After this visit I have decided when I do come back into town I will try another establishment.

Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

-KJBbCMegEGLRCBtdnQktw.text: First time here. Very average diner with average food. It was an hour before closing even though the website says 1am but they were closing at 12 . I'll come back but it won't be a first chance option. I'll like to try their dinner menu instead of breakfast. I ordered the veggie omelette and home fries.

-_nyNDuNZFXomeQCSHDRlw.text: Classic diner food at reasonable prices. As a family of 7, plus spouses and kids, we are all about a good meal at a good price.   The food is basic. Nothing is outstanding or original but the portions are good and the food is...food!   Great for a chill spot for breakfast with the family. Not a date spot for adults. Not a place to impress someone. Not a place to get "an authentic feel for Charlotte cuisine". A local place to grab some food with some smiles and be on your way.

wc5wAzfcO-7l37Tk6b5aAw.text: Mixed Bag on both Food and Service  My wife and I have been here once before years ago but in the mood for diner food so we decided to give it another try. Last time as I remember was very good.  This time turned out to be a mixed bag, Some items were beyond the control and the restaurant, the other part well within their control.  It's a popular restaurant and they share a parking lot in a small strip mall with other stores so parking is woefully inadequate. Say people not only double parking but in some cases, triple parking. Ended up dropping my wife off to get in line while I parked next door in the Darby Acres  Shopping Center Parking lot and walking over.  When I walked in, my wife told me there was a 20 minute wait which was OK.  Seating for those waiting for a table or a take out order is limited so be prepared to wait.  The 20 minutes turned out to be pretty close to actual and frankly I was expecting longer. We were seated at a small table on the other side of the divider from the counter which was OK.  Small but still was able to put my crutches in a place where they were out of the way and did not impede other diners.  Server was there shortly with menus and to take our beverage orders. My wife ordered just water and I went with  1/2 and 1/2 Sweeten Tea which was still too sweet. Hate to thing what regular sweet tea taste like.  We had looked over the menu on line before we came so we pretty much knew what we were going to order.  My wife order the Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich which is one of her favorites. Came with Fries but for $.50 more you had the option of upgrading up to Onion Rings which she did.  I ordered the Roast Tom Turkey over Dressing which came with a Salad and a Side. Tried to order a Baked Potato but that was not one of the listed sides so went with Potato Salad along with the Salad which I got with an Italian Dressing.  The Salad came out shortly along with Bread which was pretty good. The Salad was good also but unfortunately I had to look at the aftermath through out the rest of my meal as demonstrated by the attached photos.  After I was finished and when my main course was served, I asked if she would remove the dirty dishes and all I got was " in a minute".  Asked again another time but in the end, I ended up looking at these dishes throughout our stay.  Entrees in or themselves were good and portion were huge. My wife loved her Philly Cheese Steak and Onion Rings and because the portions were so large, ended up taking some home.  My Tom Turkey was also good and ended up taking some home as well. Problem was the Mustard Salad which was suppose to be Potato Salad. Could not taste anything beyond the mustard and my lips were still burning 30 minutes after I left the restaurant.   Mustard is suppose to be a subtle addition to Potato Salad and suppose to accent the dish. It's another thing to overwhelm the dish to the point that that is all you can taste and 30 minutes later, your lips are still burning.  Final problem as on check out and I did not catch this but my wife did. The $.50 upgrade to Onion Rings had become $.75. Not a big thing but became a big thing for my wife after watching dirty dishes for 20 minutes while we ate lunch.  Parking is beyond their control. Seating is within their control and they did a good job. The service including the implicit refusal to remove dirty dishes, inaccurate billing and inedible side dishes are well  within the control of the restaurant.  Some good points at the restaurant and a number of less than desirable so let's just put it this way, I've experience better and in may cases, a lot better.
