sbgit-VmHEpUCgievfZgbQ.text: Decent diner food. I had the belgian waffle and it was hard as a rock, like not edible. I Didn't say anything to waiter and I should have instead of being pissed off about it. I haven't had much experience with Belgian waffles So maybe it was supposed to be like that for this diner? That was my thought process at least. The eggs and sausage were cooked good and sausage was flavorful. Husband enjoyed his meal, a lot. We will be back, prob stick to their challah french toast which can't be beat!!

hNla0qKQf82orniJlrCxZw.text: I love Landmark Diner! I've gone there for nearly 15 years and I've always had a great meal and I've always been treated very well by their staff. My favorite menu item, since I was 6 years old, is the fried apple sticks; they are so crispy with the perfect amount of sweetness. For dessert, as a cheesecake snob, Landmark has the most AUTHENTIC New York Cheesecake in America, besides Nee York. Their cheesecake has a perfect density, sweetness, and height.

5D-rAJPhXobqtFJKszuItw.text: This was my first time here. When you first walk in, they have a selection of cakes on the right hand side. All of the cakes looked phenomenal! The staff were really friendly and we were seated immediately. I love when I go to restaurants and they don't make us wait to be seated. I forgot to mention I came with a large group and we were able to sit right in the front.   The restaurant was pretty dated and the food was just okay, so I may go back and give it another chance. Everyone I went with really loved their meal. I ordered key lime pie for dessert and it was simply amazing! But I wasn't too impressed with my Philly cheesesteak and fries.

qNhzoS5uk1-C0byfIBNMzw.text: The options seem endless, the portions are huge, and it's all pretty dang delicious.   Landmark Diner is one of those places where if you can't find anything on the menu you like, well maybe you shouldn't go out to eat. Breakfast, burgers, Greek specialties, seafood, Italian, good 'ole home cooking- seriously, they have it all. When you walk in the door, you'll see a board of specials. Pro tip: take a pic of it before you get seated.  I don't have a go-to menu item here because I'm usually craving something different each time. The one constant is that I have to start with soup, both their vegetable and French Onion are delicious. Another big hit with our group are the apple sticks (not on the regular menu, check the specials board). Some of my other favs- pork chops, Greek combo, burgers, hot open turkey sammie (I'm a sucker for things covered in gravy).   If you are a dessert fan, make sure you check out their case. It's packed with all kinds of homemade cakes, pies, turnovers, and pastries. Too full after your meal? Order a dessert to go! (You'll thank me for that later)

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

7WsUjhK01V6xIs7k4EV97w.text: I sort of get the draw to this place as they have an extensive and diverse menu.  I ordered the roasted turkey-Dressing covered in sliced turkey then covered in gravy-.  And a side of mashed potatoes and green beans.  The turkey was good. Everything else tasted like it came out of a box. The gravy and mashed potatoes were definitely instant.  Then we ordered the strawberry cake and red velvet cake.  The red velvet cake was homemade, but the cake part of the strawberry cake was premade by a factory and dry.   The food was edible and comforty in a sense, but definitely not homemade.  I think they do have homemade menu items but I feel like one would need to go down the list and ask the waitress if each item is made from scratch in order to know if it should be ordered or not.

cBWDWaoRckB7mgyF04fTKQ.text: I'm a big fan of landmark great food breakfast on point me and my sister ate there plenty of time's I always order the chef salad and the burger -N- Fries sweet tea is banging like omg this will always be my number #1 Restaurant

ujIxiBM3UuSxr2hZSyRiPA.text: Very disappointing. We made the long drive here only to find out it's not a True diner. The breakfast food that we had was average at best. We had been looking forward to a Greek diner only to be disappointed.

3FqcFruaw9zvkHN9DL-x9Q.text: All around disappointing. Went on Sunday morning at 11am. Mistake number one. Place was crazy busy with the  after church crowd.  Our party of four gave our name to the hostess to be placed on the waiting list, and crammed into a crowded foyer to wait to be called. After about an hour, we checked again with the hostess, who informed us that 'she called our name a long time ago'. They never took the effort to come into the waiting area to call us.  It just continues to go downhill from there. The service was slow, waitress looked tired, was unpersonable had a tired/angry demeanor.  Everyone working there looked like they hadn't been to sleep in the past 24 hours and projected a demeanor that they all hated their jobs. Empty water glass, and the list goes on.   Our breakfasts took 45 minutes to arrive. Food was hot, but Mediocre at best.  I won't be coming back. 2 hours of my time to eat an $11 omelette with hash browns and a coke served by a staff that just looked and acted miserable.  Even the cashier seemed apathetic. I wanted to get a dessert, but didn't feel like waiting for the tired stressed waitress to bring me one, and felt too uncomfortable to ask the cashier for one to go. I got the impression that they just would have been too bothered to box one up for me. I get better food, service and wait times at the Waffle House, which isn't saying much.  I should know better than to listen to a recommendation from that douche Guy Fieri.

vtbZ0ArIfD8SUiFVGY0Ldg.text: I just moved to the Eastland neighborhood and have been trying out all the fantastic Honduran, Vietnamese and Salvadoran places. But when I want a reliable slice of Americana (or Mediterranean), I go to Landmark.  So far, I haven't gone wrong with mousaka, lasagna, spanikopita (sp?) etc. The environment is old school, well kept and clean. And their hours are great as their prices.

ocYbszXJFz2IDNNBTWvRbA.text: You just can't go wrong with Landmark!  The food is always good and so is the service.  I've had one experience here (out of many) with poor service and the manager took care of it immediately.  Maybe she was having a bad day.  It takes a lot for us to complain, but we didn't even get to order our food (20 minutes).  None the less the manager made it up to us and our meal and service ended great!  Billy is normally our server and he is amazing!  Luck of the draw I guess...  the food is always good and we try to order something different every time.  Landmark, you're a quick trek  outside of Plaza Midwood which I don't mind making, you never disappoint!

IAvAHSX1aCFX7fiiqKifyQ.text: My boyfriend and I just left there. We sat there for over an hr and our waitress was beyond rude to us. She was very impatience with us because it took my boyfriend a few minutes to figure out what he wanted. He finally did and she rudely told him what he wanted would be a bad choice and he would send it back. So he picked Viel parmasean and she told him we don't serve that and he needed to pick something else. He did and without a trouble. I ordered and a few minutes later she comes back and says they're out of what I wanted. So I quickly picked something else. Then we watched her serve and ask how everyone else around us was doing. We sat there for 30 minutes before she even refilled our drinks or even came by to check on us. Then after 45 minutes we finally get our food. The food was amazing. We loved what we got and enjoyed our meal. Towards the end we were finishing and we waited another 10 minutes before she even came by or acknowledged us to bring us boxes. At this point we watched everyone she served before and after us leave. She finally brings us our check after being there for an hour. We were polite and kind to her. Even after the multiple times she was beyond rude to us. The customer service and this waitress is TRASH. We came here to hopefully expect a better service after the third time. Well the third time isn't a charm and we will never step foot into this establishment again.

df3eIO2NPNb90OBoG2lBbQ.text: If the service continues to be this bad, it doesn't matter how good the food is.  Who wants to wait 45 mins for an omelet!?  Crack 3 eggs, lightly scramble, add cheese, bacon, tomatos, mushrooms wait 30 seconds flip it and your done.  Thanks but no.  Going to the waffle house next time.

hgV8khq9UVKR2SLT5bfucQ.text: So this place was featured on the Food Network and I happened to be in this area of town, so went to check-it out.  The entrance to the place was a little tricky, I accidentally went to the shopping center next to it and they are not connected, but I quickly corrected that.  The restaurant seemed steady for lunch time, clean and very modern looking.  The menu is large, with a separate lunch menu and specials and sides given by the waitress.  On this trip, I ordered the turkey with corn and mashed potatoes as my sides; also cornbread and sweet tea.  It didn't take very long for food to come to the table, within' five minutes.  The turkey was laying on top of stuffing with cranberries in  a plastic container on the side, it had an impressive presentation.  The taste of the turkey was very good, and complimented well with the gravy it had on top; the stuffing was a tad sweet, so I added salt.  The corn was very fresh, while the mashed potatoes was okay.  The corn bread was a bit dry, so butter was necessary to eat with.  I did not try the cranberry sauce.  I had more than I could finished but ordered desert anyway, which was the strawberry cheesecake.  The cheesecake was very creamy and moist, which I liked, the strawberries though weren't very good, they were dark, dry, and crunchy; basically not fresh; I scrapped most to the side to finish off the slice.  The price for all this was very reasonable and I overall enjoyed the meal.  Worth going again.

hnueABrEOmiWItbyRdxeoA.text: This place is called Landmark for a reason. I have seen people from the hospitals, business execs, and average Joes on their hour lunches on the regular who I KNOW work MILES away. Honestly the only bad thing I can say about this place is that every once in a while you'll get a new server, most of them have been there for years, who is having a bad day and they won't be SUPER happy to see you. EVERY restaurant has this from time to time. Don't feel forced to eat the whole portion. Get a box and save room for a selection from their desert CASE. Literally 5ft+ tall 3-4ft wide selection of super tasty goodness from baklava to cake (5 layers ) to chess cake, chocolate strawberries, it is something you have to behold. Their menu is gargantuan and I've never had a bad meal. Not a steak lovers dream tho, and that's fine because I probably wouldn't eat anywhere else unless it was for an Asian cuisine.

Pdt9naUlFicHW9xDP4sunQ.text: This restaurant is an institution. However it is so dirty now. There was a hair in my food    It's a shame. Because the food is usually good tasting. The sanitation score is low. They need to clean up their act before I go back. Yuck

jj_NNChx7_eFhBZdYvaN1w.text: Good food comes at a fairly high price for a diner. The claim to fame of a food network show coming there is just hype... The dish isn't even the same now. The dessert case is impressive and if you get the chance to push through the crowded entrance you might even get a peek at it. The staff is a good group and almost always on top of your needs. I try to get something new each time I go. So far I have not been unsatisfied.

7SGYvH4Dm3FxRZ_1P-exLw.text: This is my go to 24 hour open diner near Plaza Midwood. Sure they have lots of standard blue plate special's, but check out their breakfast too. When you walk in they have a impressive dessert cabinet. Try their several layer chocolate cake with coffee-- anytime, day or night!

6Hj0MtXVBjhAxPZy5kNtKg.text: A lot of food for pretty cheap. Our server, Carlos, was really fun and easy to talk to. He kept our drinks full and made sure everything was up to par. If you go on ask to be seated in his section!

ZGml3RVwtGCbUAFj2PXUuA.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots....  Usually hit up Landmark on the weekends with a buddy and it's pretty packed.  You got your regulars and then the crowd ever since the diner got highlighted on the Food Network.  The outside of the building is not much to look at, but it's what's inside that counts!  Parking can be an issue if the diner is really busy, but you can usually find a space pretty quick since their turnover is fairly fast.  My friend and I have our favorite waitresses and it's always exciting to figure out who's section we are sitting in.  Overall, all the wait staff is friendly and quick.  Each have their own personalities and it definitely adds to the charm of the diner.  The only thing I have not tried here is their desserts which are in a nice display case right when you get into the restaurant.  French toast on Challah Bread is awesome!  One of my favorite things to get for lunch (if I'm not feeling it for breakfast) is the Reuben.

wOIkmQTRQH0Mcr7JDncNvw.text: Solid diner food.  I decided to check it out after seeing the place on Diners Drive-ins and Dives on The Food Network. There was a 10-15 minute wait for Sunday lunch...go a little earlier to beat the church crowd, and you probably won't have to wait.  I had the turkey gravy and dressing.  Got a piece of the carrot cake to go. Everything was excellent. Everything I saw on other tables looked great too. I'll definitely be returning.

N3gtkMsqhOvr1xUrk7Vn2Q.text: Absolutely the best diner in Charlotte. My favorite special is the country fried chicken with gravy on top and two sides. The chicken was very juicy and prepared just right. Prices are great as well. There is always something to try here and you really can't go wrong. Put this diner on your list!

3TKY3fTGF_ypFnVVxDJRqA.text: Our family has eaten here for many years.  Great for breakfast, lunch or dinner and you can get breakfast at anytime, day or night. The portions always large, even the pastries, pies and cakes!

TNnocnQ6ZaraCif6SM1q0g.text: Great place to eat, friendly staff, it truly reminds me of a New York diner the food is delicious my favorite is the Italian tour. I really recommend this dish.

ZtEEjE3kofDiRbQ4yV6wzQ.text: Very disappointed in this place. Maybe it is only good at 3am.  DO NOT GO HERE FOR GYROS.  They have the fake strips of meat that you can buy in the freezer section.

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

FH0B9F5FFoDPaOmp6nyxeQ.text: Great for a Greek diner, just don't expect much else. Landmark succeeds at what it is attempting to be, a quality northern style diner. As long as that is what you want, you will be satisfied. Menu is huge and the desserts are great. Give it a try if you are in the area.

3wzCerhnR5O6OUGE32p0rw.text: Listen people this is the spot. Stop paying too much at over priced place where the portions are small and mash potatoes are green. This place portion size it meant to feed a horse not a mouse like the other places. Like I'm coming back here over and over again. Plus my gf lives not far is its convenient.

nfx7GE8J2ZVaXnEvyaiYKQ.text: Disgusting service and horrible food. Would never ever go back. There was a blonde woman as a hostess; completely unprofessional and rude. We had a very large company order which I understand takes time to complete but the rudeness of this woman was unwarranted. Food was cold and burgers were soggy, tasted like frozen burgers, the mozzarella sticks were of the frozen kind and were half cooked. The hostess had to ring up each order separate which she complained about each and every one and said to me I assume no tip and told me over the phone I just want you to know we personally prepare this for you and other snide comments were made. Will never ever go back

e_5qAhv_VPuxMxCEPBxy4Q.text: YUM! Quick and friendly service. Breakfast served all day. Their livermush is delicious!

-ngsP3vfiwdvuRECvONzOg.text: Great place to eat on a lazy weekend morning. Kind and helpful staff who are quick on their feet and get you in and out fast. Only had one male waiter who was less the pleasant. We avoid him when we are seated.

B3pB_8G_e3Y8dCHlkwAOog.text: This place is a gem in a surprising location. Perhaps the best place in the city to get a good breakfast. Lunch and dinner is good also! Service is great. Landmark was featured on diners, drive ins and dives. Prices are reasonable and they have wifi. Very small coffee cups but the servers do a good job of keeping them full for Java addicts like myself.

w6aMc08POz2c2wOhWbXfFw.text: Having breakfast with my bestie. This waitress is the most inappropriate waitress I have ever met. She talked me out of French toast. Told us she had just her something crazy about her "baby daddy's baby momma" & that she was leaving work because she was so upset. Then I heard her tell a bunch of children she was once "a bad girl" & had been in jail for years. Tmi? Uh Yeup. Oh yeah, the food was good though.

ELCgAWn0doH3njdDQM0gdg.text: This place is awesome! When I think of a diner, I think of a place like this. I was in the mood for dessert specifically red velvet but they did not have any but they had plenty of other options.  I tried the carrot cake and tiramisu.  Both were amazing melt in your mouth options.  We did not order any main dishes but we did order two appetizers.  Their spanikopta and their baked potato dish (?) that was like a twice baked potato.  Both were extremely filling for appetizers and did not disappoint.   I did not take down for the service but I will say our waitress disappeared for a while but we were able to flag down the other waitstaff to help assist us.

GF9fjYYuugq1Jm9WWLVgMw.text: Waited at the door for a few minutes to be sat, when there where plenty of people around to help us. One server an older lady stood in front of us counting her money instead of seating us, she also walked right passed us to leave after she finished. Our server was attentive and speedy, he did how ever did not know the daily special we saw online and had to tell him what it was to order. We had a burger and country steak, both where absolutely terrible. And we barely finished then.

P6mqUWsGxXXW4bMckjaN2g.text: Don't try to phone in your order at this place. Literally just hung up after being on hold for 6 mins 45 seconds. Will be speaking to management when I go in to order my to-go order!! They put the phone down until you hang up!!! MINUS ZERO STARS!!!!!!

4MIFHokE2tOVVDMOsuh4NA.text: I went here yesterday. I waited over 5 minutes to be seated which I overlooked. I ordered a western omelet and when I cut into it a lot of white liquid came out, pretty disgusting. I was not happy with the food or service and will never go there again.

JTjRM0vDYEuax8Ez5tSpdA.text: Two stars simply bc our waitress was very nice and helpful. The food on the other hand. To start my husband and I got a salad with Greek and Italian dressing both of which had no flavor. Our entrees were edible, chicken parm and the Greek medley. Nothing to write home about but decent. The man issue I have is I ordered an apple pie and it was disgusting. The apples tasted like they came straight from a can. The crust was soft and burnt at the same time. How is that even possible?? I could get a better pie from the grocery store. And I have! Overall a complete disappointment. Especially when this place was recommended by some friends. Definitely will not be returning.

dc9OdaV6kVdk9ja9zwO7Sg.text: Holy humongous desserts, batman!  You have got to see this place!    Don't go to the Landmark expecting amazing decor. It's clean, just a little dated. What you visit this Charlotte institution for is the amazing food!   On my most recent visit with my husband and a friend of ours, we sampled the breakfast menu. It's an expected offering, but with results that soar right on over ordinary. My husband, a steak purist, declared his ribeye 'the best I've ever had'. The flavor was perfect. I asked for a gravy biscuit that wasn't on the menu, but they made it anyway. It was good and very satisfying. I've sampled other menu items over the years and never been disappointed.   After the generous meal portions, if you have room for dessert, you pretty much can't make a bad choice.  The chocolate anything will be great, their baklava is amazing, and I recently enjoyed a lemon cake that was wonderful.   Don't miss this gem, it's a great place.

Yx8mEc_58QigvFlge6FbVA.text: Landmark was one of my favorites until I discovered that after 11 am the menu and pricing for breakfast changes. Huh? Arrived before 11, waited 30 min,  then while ordering was told pricing is not the same. Should've stuck with Maria's.

OrXM2MY803fL6u2AnSZNXg.text: The food is always good, and you get plenty of it. Plus, the dessert case will make you drool.

r5NbYTFlpw9fTQINed1AHw.text: We went to Landmark Diner last week while in Charlotte because they had been featured on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives and were certainly not disappointed.  The menu selection was HUGE and the service was great.  There were 6 in my party and we all ordered different dishes and shared portions so that everyone could experience different things.  The favorites were the Lasagna and the Greek Combo.  The chocolate cake was absolutely massive and was fantastic.  The service was outstanding.  There was a very difficult couple seated near us and the staff handled the complaining diners with respect even in the face of extreme rudeness from the customers.  Our service was absolutely outstanding and the staff was courteous and engaging.  I would recommend Landmark Diner with no reservations.

41FdnyuxDlmpWuZqu-AZVw.text: Late night hazy memory food! Sooooo I can't tell you all that much about it but my gut feeling is of fondness. I think I had a club sandwich? Who knows?!  I also remember my waiter being this german dude who could have been straight out of central casting as a member of Hydra in Captain America. He was super nice though, not saying he's like in Hydra or anything... or like is actually the Red Skull. Definitely not saying that.

jgbhZeeVN0kBGSGiaG0-iw.text: I am a native Charlottean and have always known about Landmark but had never eaten there till a couple months ago.  My husband and I were there twice and enjoyed the food and the excellent service.  Although the wait it long at times, it is worth it just to stand there and salivate over the dessert cooler.  We stopped in around 8pm two weeks ago, Saturday, January 2, 2016, for our third visit.  It was not packed and we waited about 3-5 minutes to be seated.  When our waitress appeared we gave her drink orders then I asked about the "potato boat" listed in the appetizer section of their vast menu.  I had asked about it on a previous occasion and was told both the first time and this time that it is like "a warm potato salad".  I was interested the first time we were there but chose the chef salad instead.  This time I chose to order jalapeno poppers and a potato boat while my husband ordered the beef tips.  We were served my tea and my husband's beer and then after waiting about 24 minutes the waitress arrived with plates of food.  She put down a plate with fried jalapenos and a plate that I could not tell what the product was and asked the waitress while she was serving my husband's plate what it was because I thought she had brought the wrong order.    My husband and I are pranksters and I thought he was maybe pranking me because the two brown and black lumps appeared to me to be blacked horse shit.  I mean, seriously, one was burned to blackness on the top with huge black chunks of material falling off of it onto the plate and the other was very close to the same.  They were two very dark brown, oblong masses that appeared to be burned to oblivion.  This was NOT warm, or cold, potato salad or potato salad of any kind.  When the waitress advised these were potato boats I said that this was not warm potato salad and laughingly asked if she was part of the prank my husband was playing.  She said no and acted offended when I said I was not interested in eating that, that it was not what she described, and further, it was burnt to oblivion.  When I asked her if she would eat that she said "NO!". She huffed at me and said she would "take care of it", however, she left the plate of burnt horse shit or burnt shoes, whatever it was, on the table and walked off.  She came back in less than 7 minutes and picked the plate up and said "I can take this away and you do not have to eat it but the manager said since you ordered it you have to pay for it".  I just stood up and said I was not paying for that because it was nothing as described and it was burnt to oblivion and then walked out, asking the cashier if I could please pay for the food except for the burnt horse shit / burnt shoes.  He was clueless and just stood there with his mouth hanging open.  My husband was grabbing his jacket and coming out behind me.  I got to the vehicle and looked up and saw a short and chubby Hispanic or Greek looking teenager or young adult chasing him.  He got to their entryway and she blocked him from leaving by standing in front of him while he was calling me.  He said that she refused to let him out of the building and I advised him to turn around there was a door right behind him and if she touched him to protect himself.  My husband is a large man and could have seriously hurt this attacker.  I advised him I was about to call 911 because no restaurant can hold him against his will because I would not pay for burnt horse shit / burnt shoes that was supposed to be "warm potato salad".  When she realized that he was walking out she ran out behind him yelling and screaming, then behind my vehicle, while I engaged my firearm anticipating being physically attacked, and she collected my tag number and said she was calling the police.  She was smart enough not to stand behind my vehicle in an attempt to impede my exit.   This manager made a poor decision to behave this way.  Not only did I not pay for the burnt horse shit / burnt shoes, I also was not allowed to pay for anything else we ordered so they lost all of that money that night.  If that really was warm potato salad it seems to me that it would have been easier and more cost effective for them to take the alleged food back and save a customer.  We eat out more times than we eat at home and we really loved Landmark.  It could have easily been a very regular spot for us.  Their loss.  This is not the kind of restaurant I want to be a parton of.  What happened to the customer is always right?  I hope the manager enjoyed eating the burnt horse shit / burnt shoes.  No wait, I bet she didn't eat it.  In fact, I will bet no one ate it, whatever it was.  We waited for police when we arrived home but none showed.  I am appalled at the treatment and service we received at Landmark.  Not only did they serve me shit and treat me like shit, the manager could have very easily been physically hurt or killed when trying to kidnap my husband and then by chasing us in such a menacing way.

5GIIR8Or7zu0NSh-5frRgg.text: The Landmark is hit or miss now days with food and service. The staff always seem to have an argument behind the scenes going on and most do not care to express their frustrations on the floor. The food is either awesome or bland. Desserts are always reliable.

mBFUSzh47mOQb5XvZhqu3w.text: Chicken salad is great! Portions are huge. Pancakes are delicious. Menu is a little on the larger side which makes it difficult to choose your food, but it's sure to please every pallet & the pickiest of eaters.

AJ4FHFvil_zD0jTzV4nl-Q.text: This is one of the best diners in Charlotte. I've been coming here for the past 10 years and I've never been disappointed by the quality of the food OR service. It's a big restaurant with plenty of booths and tables, plus they have counter seating if you are looking for a quick visit. The menu is HUGE. They have all the classics of a diner like breakfast all day, Italian section and great burgers and sandwiches plus a Greek section and a seafood section larger than most restaurants. They don't skimp on the dressing for salads and I've never had wilted or so-so lettuce. I've tried something from every section of the menu except the kids part and I have yet to be disappointed. And service is great! My glass is never empty and they pull empty plates off the table through your meal. And the desserts are out of this world! Cheesecakes, 6 layer chocolate cake, strawberry cake, key lime pie, apple and cherry turnovers that take two people to eat. This is the place my other half and I go when we can't decide on where to go for dinner because we can each find something good every trip. The only negative I can point out is that they don't have country fried steak which is a classic diner meal...outside of that, one of the BEST restaurants in Charlotte.

AqYI0Nkj2i57b_kA0QIpPA.text: Whats all the fuss?? It's a diner, nothing special. I came here with great expectations and was really disappointed. Diners, Drive-ins. and Diners, my ASS! My bf ordered the chicken salad pita, I guess. He said it had no flavor and his fries were greasy. Baldie ate half of mine!  I ordered some kind of Philly Steak, I think. It was so memorable, as you can tell. It was good but it would've been better had it not tasted like the bread was toasted on a greasy, flat top. Again, french fries were greasy and tasted like they'd been fried in old oil. Honestly, I don't know who would think this place is so great. We gave it the benefit of the doubt and figured they'd do better with breakfast. No, its still a diner. Not a great one. I'm going back to Stack Kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Philly steak?! Greasy
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken salad, tasteless

RB0lmgVQ-Hbbqi8uNfmaLg.text: Oh Landmark! What happened to your service?!? This time that I came, I had to see what I've been hearing. They've changed waiters and well, lets say the service is definitely not the same as it used to be.  For example it took at least 15 minutes to just get our water, and note that the restaurant wasn't busy at all. The waiter had only about 3 other tables and she already looked busy.   Another reason was that when I ordered a plate and wanted to share it with my mother because she wasn't so hungry, the waiter said they charged extra! What?!? What kind of restaurant requires you to pay extra to share?! We asked her that's the first I've ever heard of that, and she said she didnt want to get in trouble and to "let it go" and make it seem like we were wrong.   Sadly, I think it might be time for my business to go elsewhere as one of the best restaurants in my view has went in the gutter. It might not be the food, but service is definitely a deciding factor for my family and I.

2j5zG85aIZjBmEjQl03rAw.text: This was our second time here and it did not disappoint. We had appetizers, entrees and dessert and it was all great. Our service was pretty good too. We also received a show with dinner as one of the other patrons sang before they ate. Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black tuxedo cake
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Landmark Diner Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chopped steak

yqhNiHPmPQm7byeobJGJTg.text: I don't like reading lengthy reviews so this will be short...   1. Needs remodeling, cuts in the seats and I mean big ones.   2. Food is ok, midnight diner off S tryon is wayyyy better. Cooks don't remember what you order.   3. Discrimination!!!! went there on Friday night (@ 2am it closes at 3am) this past weekend and the door was locked with customers in there. The restaurant wasn't letting people they thought associated with CIAA in. Now I don't know how you can tell who's associated with CIAA when we were dressed normal. As much as that conference brings money to the city they should've been welcoming customers.   Word of advice Landmark if you don't want to be associated with CIAA "affiliates" you definitely don't need to be located on that side of town.

_YDJ7CTlZHkjhIMTo6BK4Q.text: Dear, Destiny          You might think serving tables is the job field for you but it isn't!!! You were the most ditzy waitress ever!!!! Worst service I've ever gotten here! Thank god for the awesome gay server that saved the day!!!

Nq7g3YQanAVDIzw6HHON1g.text: Me and my family have been eating here for years we used to live in the area I always order a salad the ranch dressing is exceptional and homemade the menu is very large though and can be overwhelming

qfseV-vRguLe2P0tsf-8oQ.text: I'm a big fan, and I can't really add much to what's already been said in the other positive reviews.  I used to come fairly frequently as a kid, and didn't really appreciate what it was. When I came back recently, I was compelled to try the turkey and dressing by the same Triple D episode everyone's probably seen a dozen times. But it definitely doesn't disappoint. The portion they give you is so huge, the turkey and dressing get their own separate plate, while your sides get a second one.  I ate until I was stuffed, then brought home a box that probably weighed close to a pound. (And then I ate that like an hour and a half later because it was so good I couldn't get it out of my head.)  My family kinda hated their experience, because we had to wait FOREVER.  But, in Landmark's defense, it was a Sunday afternoon at about 1pm, and we had a party of six. I didn't mind waiting, and understood it. But if you're coming with a party much bigger than two, and you're not in a patient mood, you may want to choose somewhere else.

euXBnb-He04HkA3LXRlI9A.text: It was good, but my eggs and hash browns were cold, and slightly late. Also, the water tasted kind of weird. Other than that, it was rather good! Large serving sizes though. The waitress was very very nice!

VWINMGtDZ0lI3UPBUK0fOA.text: One day I'm going here with the sole purpose of trying every desert. No meal. I'll just just start ordering slice of pie after slice of cake after pastry with coffee. I will get very very sick. I may die.   Landmark makes the best deserts in Charlotte and they are made in house. These are working man's deserts, chocked full of refined sugar and flour, steroids for diabetes. No fru fru half a bite macaroon eclair brule or whatever fancy nancys eat for an after meal treat.  My favorites are the tuxedo mousse cake and the tall chocolate cake. So I'm like that German kid from Willy Wonka and the chocoloate factory with chocolate all over my face. I don't care.  The regular menu is fairly hit or miss. The souvlaki and spanakopita are a hit. The fried chicken is a miss. The onion rings are a big hit, but the fries are not. It's weird yeah?  There are salads I guess, for joggers or those people who don't think they're gonna die or whatever.  It's open until 3 am. This is the best alternative to waiting in line at Midnight Diner like animals.

Uk_4T8SE86MSsvOxzChEDQ.text: New to the area and wanted real diner food. We came to the Landmark not knowing anything about the place......WOW......Huge menu and food was fantastic and so much of it. We're used to paying NY prices so $15 per meal was a steal and plenty of leftovers.  The wait staff was good and knew the answers to our questions. We have been a few times now and plan on trying it for breakfast very soon. As for Guy being there.....Who cares....he's a stiff unlike this place.

kR0nPs4Y9P4rXNyUbUZV4Q.text: I like this place for the variety of the food, but if you can't scramble eggs without them looking like an omelet this might not be the spot. Crappy job, and crappy customer service in response to the eggs. "Thats just the way they do them" what happenned to fluffy?  By the way, good customer service STILL matters. Don't accept poor service! Affect them with your lack of $upport, maybe then they will take it more seriously.

FqNOa61XZJoxKLjTA3VZzg.text: This is not your ordinary diner on the road. We came here bc it's near our new apartment and open til 4am.  The restaurant is very big, and when u first walk in there's a glass cabinet full of dessert that makes u don't want to ever leave the place. Not to mention it was famous for that in travel channel.  My bf ordered grilled chicken filet with sunny side up egg and fried potato. The fried potato was good, and has full flavor to it. Doesn't even need ketchup or honey mustard. However, the chicken is a bit too dried. It had good flavor just too dried.  I ordered the challah French toast as recommended by many yelp users. And oh god it's anything but classic French toast. First, the size of the toast is huge!! It's very fluffy and not overly sweet even after I pour half bottle of maple syrup to it. By the way, the syrup was Warm!!! That makes the toast even better.   The portion was so huge, we have leftover for lunch and dinner. The only thing I take a star off is for the server. She literally didn't check on us after she dropped off the food.  It's a place we will definitely go back, especially for brunch and late night munches

XSxslI3rqAwJjowmKTfpLQ.text: We come here every year with my mother. We are never disappointed with the desserts. The case is always attractive.  The portions are huge.  If you can share do it. We always leave with over half our food. The atmosphere is fun,  our waiter made the night, he knew everything about the menu and was very helpful. The food is ok.  Dessert is better!

vEoE3u5ytgqtp0JnH9Dp5Q.text: A few years ago this was my favorite restaurant. Then I had a horrible encounter with one of the guys who still works there over some over medium eggs which were first almost raw and then brown and cooked solid. I didn't go back for a long time and now it seems that the service isn't what it once was. One waiter that I had for breakfast recently had an outright nasty attitude and was so rude that he was actually complaining to us about the people at one of his other tables. There are a few girls who are still very friendly and helpful and the food is usually good but don't stay too long after you are finished eating because they may ask you to leave.  My suggestion, takeout! The spanakopita is amazing.

EFKy0XIkpzKtrkcEplm4nQ.text: Menu is way way way to big! Its overwhelming the literal size and amount of items. I think the best thing they have going for them is the dessert display and the popularity from Diners, Drive Ins and Dives!

PH9qpvI3mDRTvf9v2lT7mw.text: Landmark Diner is one of Charlotte's most popular restaurants so we decided to check them out and what we found was less than impressive. The menu was giant and I know a lot of people like all of those options but we aren't among them.   From our experience the more items you have available on a menu the less attention the chef can pay to each dish and its quality. Everything we ate was good but not great, and the only thing we really hated was the rugelach.   Check them out for yourself and see what you think.

d8HSzw6u1fa5mfaJobHuow.text: Recommended by a local who lives in NoDa (shorthand for North Davidson), someplace cool in Charlotte's mind, but not mine.  At any rate, the Landmark is not in NoDa.  It is in this amorphous area of town, but on Central Avenue.  Since they feed you plenty in the South, I wasn't hungry when I went in for dinner.  I saw those desserts in the glass case and decided that would suffice.  I threw in a cup of coffee.  The cheesecake I had was abundant and delicious.  The coffee was coffee.  It was later in the evening, at around 10 p.m., and it was crowded.  I could see and smell entree plates going by, and they had to have been good.  Of 3 days spent in Charlotte in the recent past, this is the place I went to with the most character and the best following.

BAYrCNlxcaFST8Ys3SZzpw.text: First off, I know it's kinda dumb... but I took away one star based upon the size of your menus. They are ridiculous. The menu is at least 2 feet tall and 2 feet wide. I couldn't see my fiance while we were both trying to decide what to eat, I got a neck cramp trying to see her over my menu. If this gets fixed I will give you a 4 star :) Service was fast and friendly. The food was decent. The broccoli cheddar omelette and home-fries my fiance got were on point. I had the Philly Melt, and to be honest, I was disappointed. You will be able to find pictures of what we ate if you check the restaurants images. My Philly Melt LOOKED amazing... it had a lot of cheese,,,  the cook even obliged and added grilled onions, and mushrooms. BUT it all tasted pretty bland. The meat itself didn't melt in your mouth like I expect a real Philly to. The meat was't BAD, just not tender enough to be legit. I didn't enjoy the batter on the onion rings, maybe they needed to change the oil. I picked up a baked treat on the way out. All of there baked goodies looked freshly made.

fz2_aEbJPy0EtCLZ8_TAKQ.text: I have not been to Landmark in a few years, so I was excited to come back and try it again. As luck would have it, I even got to go twice in the same weekend.  FOOD I think the menu is too extensive and really wish they would cut it down. If you have never been to the Landmark before, it can be a challenge choosing what to get. I had a Greek chicken dish the first night and the pizza burger. Both tasted great, and the pizza burger was definitely unique.I tried the chocolate cake and key lime pie for dessert. Both were excellent.  PRICE The prices are fair. Expect to pay $10-ish for dinner and around $3-$5 for dessert.  SERVICE The first night that I went the service was a tad slow, but other than that, it was fine. Our server was very friendly and seemed to really enjoy his job. Had I not gone back to Landmark, I might have ended my review wondering why people complained so much about Landmark's service. The second night the service was just...strange. My friend ordered some soup and chicken strips, and our server promptly asked if he had eaten the chicken strips before. He stated he had and liked them, to which the server exclaimed how nasty they are. Sorry, lady, but that's not something you tell a customer when the customer has said he enjoys them. The server then brought my friend's soup out and immediately exclaimed how plain and gross soup is and how she does not eat soup. This didn't end here, though. When I ordered my dessert, I had the joy (that's sarcasm) of hearing our server talk about how she hates dessert. I asked her what she likes and she just responded "food". Ya, I would never have guessed that human beings actually like food.  Well, I'll be back and would certainly recommend Landmark, but they need to hire some additional servers and do a better job at interviewing and selecting servers.

vYX7ape3uL6X3mSdoPPGTw.text: It was busy!! Went with a group of friends who always go when they are in town. They like to go for the prices, food quantity and Guy Fierre are there.  Huge portions. Diner food. They were so busy that even though the menu is huge food must be fresh.   I had the lasagna, Dan the spaghetti and grilled chicken. Good diner eats ... BUT the baklava... Eat it!
